examples.en: He tends to overpossess his partners, checking their messages and questioning their friendships.
examples.zh: 他对伴侣的占有欲过强，经常查看对方信息，还质疑对方的朋友圈。

examples.en: If you overpossess your child, they may feel suffocated and pull away.
examples.zh: 如果你过分控制孩子，他们可能会觉得窒息而疏远你。

definition.en: (rare) to own more of something than is reasonable or needed
definition.zh: （罕见）占有过多（超过合理或需要的数量）

examples.en: Some critics say large companies overpossess resources that communities also need.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为大型企业占有过多资源，而社区同样需要这些资源。

extraExplanation: “overpossess”不是常见的标准词汇，很多情况下更自然的表达是：be overly possessive（占有欲过强）、be controlling（控制欲强）、cling to（紧抓不放）、smother（让人喘不过气的关心/控制）。
写作中如果你用“overpossess”，读者可能能猜到意思，但会觉得生硬或不地道；在正式场合建议改用更常见的搭配。

summary.en: Overpossessive describes someone who is too controlling or jealous in a relationship.
summary.zh: overpossessive 指在关系中过度占有、过分控制或不健康地嫉妒。

definition.en: Too controlling or protective in a relationship because you feel you “own” someone or fear losing them; jealous in an unhealthy way.
definition.zh: （在感情或人际关系中）过度占有欲强的；因害怕失去而过分控制、保护的；不健康的嫉妒。

examples.en: He became overpossessive and didn’t want her to spend time with friends.
examples.zh: 他变得过度占有，不希望她和朋友出去。

examples.en: An overpossessive partner may check your phone or demand constant updates.
examples.zh: 过度占有欲强的伴侣可能会查看你的手机，或要求你随时汇报。

examples.en: She realized his overpossessive behavior was a warning sign and set clear boundaries.
examples.zh: 她意识到他过度占有的行为是危险信号，于是设立了明确界限。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太……”，possessive 原意是“占有的/占有欲强的”。合在一起强调“超过正常程度的占有欲”。
常用于描述亲密关系中的控制行为（如限制社交、过度查岗、干涉穿着等）。在沟通中，这是比较负面的评价；更中性的说法可以用 controlling（爱控制的）或 overly protective（过度保护的，语气相对缓和）。
近义表达：overly possessive（更常见的写法）、clingy（黏人的，侧重依赖）、jealous（嫉妒的，范围更广）。

summary.en: “Overpost” means to post excessively or repeatedly, especially online.
summary.zh: “overpost”指在网络上发帖/发消息过多或反复发布，常带“刷屏、打扰”的含义。

definition.en: to post too much, especially on social media or in a chat group (so that others may feel overwhelmed or annoyed)
definition.zh: （尤指在社交媒体或群聊中）发帖/发消息过多，刷屏，导致他人觉得打扰或厌烦

examples.en: Please don’t overpost in the class group—save your questions for one message.
examples.zh: 请不要在班级群里过度发消息——把问题集中在一条里。

examples.en: He overposted about the event all week, so some friends muted him.
examples.zh: 他一整周都在过度发活动相关内容，所以有些朋友把他静音了。

definition.en: to post something again and again across multiple places or threads (often unnecessarily)
definition.zh: （常带贬义）在多个地方/帖子里反复发布同样内容，重复贴、到处贴

examples.en: The same link was overposted in several channels.
examples.zh: 同一个链接被在好几个频道里重复发布。

examples.en: Don’t overpost the announcement—one post is enough.
examples.zh: 别把公告到处重复发——发一次就够了。

extraExplanation: “over-”作前缀常表示“过度、超过需要”（如 overeat 吃太多、overwork 过度工作）。因此 overpost 通常强调“多到不合适”。
在网络语境里，overpost 常含轻微批评：不是单纯“发得多”，而是“让别人觉得被打扰/信息噪音太多”。更中性的说法可以用 post frequently（经常发帖）、be very active online（很活跃）。
如果你想表达“刷屏”，也常见 spam the chat / flood the chat（语气更强、更负面）。

summary.en: Overpot means repotting a plant into a pot that’s too large for it.
summary.zh: overpot 指把植物换到（或栽进）对它来说过大的花盆里。

definition.en: to put a plant into a pot that is too large for its root system; to repot a plant into an oversized container (often causing watering problems)
definition.zh: 把植物栽进对根系来说过大的花盆里；给植物换到过大的盆中（常会导致浇水与烂根等问题）

examples.en: I overpotted my snake plant, and the soil stayed wet for too long.
examples.zh: 我把虎尾兰栽进了过大的盆里，结果土一直干不了。

examples.en: Try not to overpot seedlings—move up one pot size at a time.
examples.zh: 尽量别给幼苗换到过大的盆里——一次只升一级盆径就好。

extraExplanation: “overpot”在园艺语境里更常见于口语或种植社区，不算非常正式的词。更常见的表达是“pot (a plant) into too large a pot / use too big a pot”。
园艺上常说“盆太大”会让土壤长时间潮湿、根系缺氧，尤其对多肉、虎尾兰等耐旱植物更明显；通常建议循序渐进换盆（one size up）。

summary.en: Overpotency means excessive strength or potency, especially when a medicine or product is stronger than intended.
summary.zh: Overpotency 指效力或强度过高，尤指药品或产品的效力强于预期/规格。

definition.en: the state of being too strong or too powerful (often used for medicines, chemicals, or products that are stronger than intended)
definition.zh: 效力过强；药力/浓度/强度过高（常用于药品、化学品或产品的强度高于预期）

examples.en: The lab discovered overpotency in the batch, so the pills were recalled.
examples.zh: 实验室发现该批次药片效力过强，因此进行了召回。

examples.en: Overpotency can cause stronger side effects than the label warns about.
examples.zh: 效力过强可能导致比标签警示更强的副作用。

extraExplanation: “overpotency”在日常英语中不算常见，更常出现在制药、质量控制（QC）、法规/合规文件里，用来描述“含量或效价超出规格（out of specification）”。
构词上是 over-（过度）+ potency（效力/强度）。在药品领域，potency 常指有效成分的“效价/含量”，并不只是“强大”这种泛泛的意思。

summary.en: Overpotent means “too strong or too potent,” especially when the strength is more than intended or safe.
summary.zh: overpotent 指“（效力/味道等）过强”，尤其强调强度超过预期或安全/合适范围。

definition.en: Too potent or strong in effect; stronger than intended, safe, or appropriate (often used about medicine, chemicals, alcohol, or flavors).
definition.zh: （效果）过于强烈的；药效/作用强到超出预期、超出安全或合适范围的（常用于药物、化学品、酒精或味道）。

examples.en: The pharmacist warned that the dose could be overpotent for a child.
examples.zh: 药剂师警告说，这个剂量对孩子来说可能药效过强。

examples.en: This disinfectant is overpotent for routine cleaning—dilute it as instructed.
examples.zh: 这种消毒剂用于日常清洁作用过强——请按说明稀释。

examples.en: The sauce tastes overpotent, so add a little water or cream.
examples.zh: 这酱味道太浓烈了，可以加一点水或奶油。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、超过（正常/需要的程度）”，“potent”表示“强效的、有力的”。合起来的“overpotent”多见于医疗/药学或说明性语境，强调“强到不合适、可能有风险”。日常口语里也可用更常见的表达，如“too strong / overly strong / too potent”。

summary.en: Overpotential is the extra voltage required beyond the theoretical voltage to drive an electrochemical reaction at a practical rate.
summary.zh: 过电位是指为使电化学反应以实际可用的速率进行而需要超过理论电压的那部分额外电压。

definition.en: (Electrochemistry) The extra voltage needed beyond the theoretical (equilibrium) voltage to make an electrochemical reaction proceed at a desired rate.
definition.zh: （电化学）为了让电化学反应以所需速率进行，除了理论（平衡）电压之外还需要额外施加的电压。

examples.en: Hydrogen evolution often requires a significant overpotential on some metal surfaces.
examples.zh: 在某些金属表面上，析氢反应通常需要较大的过电位。

examples.en: Lower overpotential means the catalyst can drive the reaction more efficiently.
examples.zh: 更低的过电位意味着催化剂能更高效地推动反应。

extraExplanation: “Overpotential”常见于电池、电解水、燃料电池与腐蚀等语境。它反映了体系中的实际损失与动力学/传质限制，因此实际测得的电压常高于（或低于）热力学预测值。
过电位通常可分为：活化过电位（反应动力学慢导致）、浓差过电位（反应物/产物传质受限导致）、欧姆过电位（电阻造成的电压降；有时单独称为 IR drop，不一定归入 overpotential，取决于教材/论文定义）。
在电催化研究中，人们常用“在某电流密度下的过电位”（如 η@10 mA/cm²）来比较催化剂性能：在同样电流下，所需过电位越小通常代表催化性能越好。

summary.en: Overpotently means “too powerfully” or “in an overly dominating way.”
summary.zh: overpotently 指“过于强大/强烈地”，也可指“过分支配、影响力过强地”。

definition.en: In a way that is too powerful or strong; excessively forcefully or effectively.
definition.zh: 以过于强大或强烈的方式；过分有力地（或过分有效地）。

examples.en: The spice was added overpotently, so the dish tasted bitter and harsh.
examples.zh: 香料加得过猛，所以这道菜尝起来又苦又冲。

examples.en: He argued overpotently, leaving no room for other opinions.
examples.zh: 他辩论得过于强势，让别人几乎没有表达意见的空间。

definition.en: (Rare) In a way that is excessively influential or dominating.
definition.zh: （较少见）以过度影响他人或过度支配的方式。

examples.en: The celebrity’s presence worked overpotently on the crowd’s mood.
examples.zh: 这位名人的出现对人群情绪产生了过强的影响。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，更多时候人们会用更常见的表达来替代，比如：too powerfully（太强烈地）、overly strongly（过分强烈地）、with overwhelming force（以压倒性的力量）。
构词上可以拆成 over-（过度）+ potent（强有力的）+ -ly（副词后缀）。理解词根 potent 有助于记忆：它和 power（力量）意义接近，也出现在 potential（潜力）等词里。

summary.en: Overpotentness means the state of being too potent or too strong.
summary.zh: overpotentness 指“过于强效/过强”的状态或性质。

definition.en: The quality of being too potent or too strong (for example, a medicine, chemical, smell, flavor, or effect that is stronger than needed or safe).
definition.zh: （效力、强度、味道、气味或影响等）过强、过于有效（以至于不合适或不安全）的性质；过强性。

examples.en: The overpotentness of the cleaner irritated my eyes, so I switched to a milder one.
examples.zh: 这款清洁剂过强，刺激了我的眼睛，所以我换成了更温和的。

examples.en: The doctor adjusted the dose because the overpotentness of the medication caused dizziness.
examples.zh: 医生调整了剂量，因为药效过强导致头晕。

extraExplanation: “overpotentness”并不是常见词，更像是临时造词（creative coinage）。它由 over-（过度）+ potent（强效的）+ -ness（名词后缀）构成，用来强调“强到过头”的程度。
在更自然的表达中，英语里常用 “excessive potency”（过高的效力）、“too strong”（太强）、“overly potent”（过于强效）来替代。

summary.en: Overpour means to pour too much liquid—more than intended or needed.
summary.zh: overpour 指把液体倒得过多，超过原本需要或打算的量。

definition.en: to pour too much of a liquid, so that the amount is more than needed or intended (sometimes causing a spill).
definition.zh: 倒得太多（液体），超过所需或本来打算的量（有时会洒出来）。

examples.en: Be careful not to overpour the milk into the bowl.
examples.zh: 小心别把牛奶倒进碗里倒太多。

examples.en: The bartender overpoured, so the drink tasted too strong.
examples.zh: 调酒师倒多了，所以这杯酒喝起来太烈。

examples.en: I overpoured the syrup and made the pancakes too sweet.
examples.zh: 我糖浆倒太多了，把煎饼弄得太甜。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、超过”，所以 overpour = pour（倒）+ 过量。常见于做饭、调饮料、冲咖啡等场景。
和 “overflow（溢出）” 的区别：overpour 强调“动作/人为倒多了”；overflow 更强调“结果/液体满到溢出来”，不一定是因为倒得太多。

summary.en: Overpower means to defeat/control by greater strength, or to affect someone so strongly (emotion, smell, sound) that it dominates; overpowering describes something extremely intense.
summary.zh: overpower 指凭更强力量击败或制服，也指情绪、气味、声音等强烈到压倒一切；overpowering 形容“极强烈、难以忽视/抗拒”。

definition.en: To defeat or control someone by being stronger, or to overcome someone’s resistance.
definition.zh: （凭更强的力量）击败、制服；压倒对方的反抗。

examples.en: The police were able to overpower the suspect without anyone getting hurt.
examples.zh: 警方成功制服了嫌疑人，没有人受伤。

examples.en: She tried to resist, but he quickly overpowered her.
examples.zh: 她试图反抗，但他很快就把她制服了。

definition.en: To be so strong that it becomes hard to think, act, or notice anything else (often about feelings, smells, or sounds).
definition.zh: （力量大到）使人无法思考或行动；（常指情绪、气味、声音等）强烈到压倒一切。

examples.en: An overpowering smell of smoke filled the room.
examples.zh: 房间里充满了浓烈刺鼻的烟味。

examples.en: He was overpowered by grief after the funeral.
examples.zh: 葬礼后，他被悲痛彻底击垮了。

definition.en: Extremely strong or intense; hard to resist or ignore.
definition.zh: （程度）极强的、难以抗拒的、压倒性的。

examples.en: The soup has an overpowering garlic taste.
examples.zh: 这汤的大蒜味太冲了。

examples.en: She felt an overpowering urge to laugh.
examples.zh: 她感到一阵强烈到难以克制的想笑冲动。

extraExplanation: “overpower”由 over-（超过、压过）+ power（力量）构成，核心意思是“用更大的力量压倒/压制”。在描写气味或味道时，overpowering 往往带有“太浓、太冲”的负面评价，如“overpowering perfume”（香水味太重）。
在写作里，“be overpowered by + 情绪/感觉”很常见，语气比“be very sad”更强，强调“被情绪吞没、失去控制”。

summary.en: Overpowered means either “too powerful/unbalanced” (often in games) or “defeated/controlled by force.”
summary.zh: overpowered 可指“强得过头/不平衡（游戏中常用）”，也可指“被力量压倒或制服”。

definition.en: Too strong, effective, or powerful compared with what is needed or what others have; unbalanced.
definition.zh: 过于强大（强到不合理）；力量或效果远超所需或他人，导致不平衡。

examples.en: The medicine felt overpowered for a mild headache.
examples.zh: 这种药对轻微头痛来说感觉太猛了。

examples.en: In the debate, his overpowered voice drowned out everyone else.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他过于强势的嗓音压过了所有人。

definition.en: (Games) So strong that it gives an unfair advantage and hurts balance; often said as “OP.”
definition.zh: （游戏）强得离谱，造成不公平优势、破坏平衡；常简称为“OP”。

examples.en: Players say this character is overpowered and needs a nerf.
examples.zh: 玩家说这个角色太OP了，需要削弱。

examples.en: That weapon is overpowered at low levels.
examples.zh: 那把武器在低等级时强得不合理。

definition.en: Defeated or controlled by stronger force; unable to resist (past participle of “overpower”).
definition.zh: 被压倒、制服；无力反抗（动词 overpower 的过去分词用法）。

examples.en: She was overpowered by the attacker and called for help.
examples.zh: 她被袭击者制服了，于是呼救。

examples.en: He felt overpowered by fear and couldn’t speak.
examples.zh: 他被恐惧压倒，一句话也说不出来。

extraExplanation: “overpowered”在日常语境里多指“强到过头”，常带一点批评或担心（比如影响公平、掩盖其他声音/元素）。在游戏圈尤其常见，常写作“OP”。
注意区分两种感觉：形容东西“overpowered”=太强/太猛；形容人“was overpowered”=被制服/被压倒（这是动词 overpower 的被动结果）。

summary.en: Overpowerful means too powerful—stronger than is appropriate or safe.
summary.zh: overpowerful 表示“过于强大/强得过头”，带有不合适或不安全的意味。

definition.en: Too powerful; stronger than is desirable, safe, or necessary.
definition.zh: 过于强大（强到不合适、不安全或不必要）。

examples.en: The medicine felt overpowerful for such a mild headache.
examples.zh: 这种药对这么轻微的头痛来说显得过于强效。

examples.en: Some players said the new character was overpowerful and made the game unfair.
examples.zh: 一些玩家说新角色过于强大，导致游戏不公平。

extraExplanation: “over-” 是常见前缀，表示“过度、超过正常范围”。因此 overpowerful 通常带有“强过头”的评价色彩。
在日常英语里，人们更常用的表达是 “overpowered”（尤其在游戏语境里，指“强得离谱/失衡”），或用 “too powerful / overly powerful”。“overpowerful”也能理解，但相对不如这些常见。

summary.en: Overpowerfully means “very strongly or intensely,” often so strong it overwhelms people or defeats resistance.
summary.zh: overpowerfully 表示“非常强烈/强大地”，强到让人难以抗拒、难以控制，或带有“压倒性地制服/击败”的意思。

definition.en: In a very strong or intense way that is hard to resist, control, or ignore.
definition.zh: 以非常强烈、强大到难以抗拒、控制或忽视的方式。

examples.en: The music was overpowerfully loud in the small room.
examples.zh: 在那间小房间里，音乐大得让人受不了。

examples.en: She felt overpowerfully nervous before speaking in public.
examples.zh: 在公众场合发言前，她紧张得几乎无法控制。

examples.en: The smell of paint hit us overpowerfully as we walked in.
examples.zh: 我们一走进去，油漆味就浓烈得扑面而来。

definition.en: In a way that defeats or overwhelms someone or something by force or superior power.
definition.zh: 以压倒性的力量击败或制服（某人或某事）的方式。

examples.en: The larger team played overpowerfully and won easily.
examples.zh: 更强的那支队伍打得极具压制力，轻松获胜。

examples.en: The army advanced overpowerfully, leaving little room for resistance.
examples.zh: 军队以压倒性的势头推进，几乎不给对方抵抗的空间。

extraExplanation: “overpowerfully”由 over-（过度、超过）+ powerful（强有力的）+ -ly（副词后缀）构成，但在日常英语里不算常见。口语和写作中更常用的表达有：very powerfully / extremely powerfully / overwhelmingly / with overwhelming force。
在描述气味、声音、情绪时，“overpowering/overwhelming”非常常用，例如：an overpowering smell（刺鼻的气味）、an overwhelming sense of relief（如释重负）。在这种语境里，用“overpowerfully”会显得更书面或不太自然，建议根据场景选择更地道的替换。

summary.en: Overpowerfulness means extreme strength or dominance that can overwhelm others.
summary.zh: Overpowerfulness 指极其强大或占主导地位的特质，强到可能压倒他人。

definition.en: the quality of being extremely strong or dominant, sometimes so strong that it controls or overwhelms others
definition.zh: 极其强大或占主导地位的特质；强到足以控制或压倒他人的力量

examples.en: People criticized the boss’s overpowerfulness because it silenced other voices in the team.
examples.zh: 人们批评那位老板的“过度强势”，因为这让团队里其他人的声音被压制了。

examples.en: The novel shows how political overpowerfulness can turn fear into obedience.
examples.zh: 这部小说展现了政治上的过度强权如何把恐惧变成顺从。

extraExplanation: “overpowerfulness”在现代英语里非常少见，听起来有点“造词感”。更常用、更自然的表达包括：overwhelming power（压倒性的力量）, dominance（支配/优势）, excessive force（过度武力）, overbearingness（专横、盛气凌人）。
它来自形容词“overpowerful（过于强大的）”+ 名词后缀“-ness（……的性质）”。在写作中，如果你想表达“强到令人不适/压制他人”，用“overbearingness”或“domineering behavior”往往更贴切。

summary.en: Overpowering means extremely strong in effect (hard to resist) or strong enough to defeat/control others.
summary.zh: Overpowering 指影响/感受极其强烈到难以抗拒，或力量上足以战胜、压制他人。

definition.en: Very strong in effect, often so intense that it is hard to resist or ignore (can be used for feelings, smells, tastes, beauty, etc.).
definition.zh: （影响或感受）非常强烈的，强到让人难以抗拒或忽视（可形容情绪、气味、味道、美感等）。

examples.en: There was an overpowering smell of smoke in the room.
examples.zh: 房间里有一股令人难以忍受的浓烈烟味。

examples.en: She felt an overpowering need to call her family.
examples.zh: 她感到一种强烈到无法压抑的冲动，想给家人打电话。

examples.en: The sunset was beautiful, almost overpowering.
examples.zh: 夕阳很美，美得几乎让人招架不住。

definition.en: Defeating or controlling someone by using greater power; stronger than an opponent.
definition.zh: 以更强的力量战胜或压制对方的；占压倒性优势的。

examples.en: The team won with an overpowering offense.
examples.zh: 这支球队凭借压倒性的进攻取胜。

examples.en: He used an overpowering grip to hold the attacker back.
examples.zh: 他用强有力的抓握压制住袭击者。

extraExplanation:
“overpowering”常见两类用法：
1）描述“感官/情绪强烈到令人受不了或难以忽视”（气味、香水、辣味、音乐、悲伤、爱等）；
2）描述“力量上压制对方”。
日常表达里，第1类更常见。

搭配建议：
- an overpowering smell/scent/perfume（浓烈的气味/香味/香水味）
- an overpowering sense/feeling/need（强烈的感觉/情绪/需求）
- overpowering beauty/sorrow（震撼人的美/悲伤）
语气通常偏“过强、让人招架不住”，有时带一点负面。

summary.en: “Overpoweringly” means “in an extremely strong or overwhelming way.”
summary.zh: “overpoweringly”表示“以极其强烈、压倒性的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that is so strong, intense, or impressive that it is hard to resist or think about anything else.
definition.zh: 以强烈到难以抗拒或难以专注于其他事物的方式；压倒性地。

examples.en: The room smelled overpoweringly of perfume.
examples.zh: 房间里香水味浓得令人受不了。

examples.en: She felt overpoweringly nervous before the interview.
examples.zh: 面试前她紧张得几乎无法控制。

examples.en: The evidence was overpoweringly clear.
examples.zh: 证据清楚得具有压倒性。

extraExplanation: “overpoweringly”来自动词“overpower”（压倒、制服、使难以承受）。在日常英语中，它常用来形容气味、情绪、感觉或证据等“强到盖过一切”的程度。
语气上它通常带有“太强、过度、令人难以承受”的暗示（尤其形容气味或情绪时），但也可用于正面语境，如“overpoweringly beautiful”（美得令人屏息）。

summary.en: Overpoweringness means the quality of being so strong or intense that it feels hard to resist or handle.
summary.zh: Overpoweringness 指“强烈到令人难以抗拒或承受的压倒性程度”。

definition.en: The quality of being overpowering; a very strong intensity that is hard to resist, ignore, or deal with (often of a smell, feeling, sound, or force).
definition.zh: “压倒性的”特质；强烈到让人难以抗拒、忽视或承受的程度（常指气味、情绪、声音或力量）。

examples.en: The overpoweringness of the perfume gave me a headache.
examples.zh: 这香水的味道太冲、太强烈，让我头疼。

examples.en: He tried to stay calm, but the overpoweringness of his anxiety took over.
examples.zh: 他努力保持冷静，但焦虑的压迫感太强，最终占了上风。

examples.en: Many people struggled with the overpoweringness of the crowd noise.
examples.zh: 很多人都受不了人群噪音的压迫感和强度。

extraExplanation: “overpoweringness”是由形容词 overpowering（压倒性的、强烈得难以招架的）+ 名词后缀 -ness（……的性质/状态）构成，意思很直观。
在实际写作中它相对少见，更常用的表达包括：the overpowering smell/intensity/force（压倒性的气味/强度/力量）、overwhelmingness（令人难以承受的程度）、overwhelming intensity（极强的强度）。如果你想更自然地表达，通常用这些搭配会更地道。

summary.en: “Overpowers” means defeats/controls by greater force, or overwhelms someone strongly (feelings, smells, etc.).
summary.zh: “overpowers”表示用更强的力量制服/压倒，或指强烈的感受、气味等使人难以抗拒。

definition.en: to defeat or control someone by using greater physical strength, force, or power
definition.zh: 用更强的力量或武力击败、制服（某人）

examples.en: The guards overpower the attacker within seconds.
examples.zh: 警卫在几秒钟内就制服了袭击者。

examples.en: He tries to overpower his opponent in the first round.
examples.zh: 他试图在第一回合就压制对手。

definition.en: to affect someone so strongly that it is hard to resist (often feelings, smells, or sensations)
definition.zh: 强烈影响到让人难以抗拒（常指情绪、气味或感觉）

examples.en: The smell of smoke overpowers her as she walks into the room.
examples.zh: 她走进房间时，烟味扑面而来，强烈得让人难受。

examples.en: Grief overpowers him when he reads the letter.
examples.zh: 他读到那封信时，悲痛瞬间淹没了他。

extraExplanation: “overpowers”是动词“overpower”的第三人称单数现在时形式（he/she/it overpowers）。常见结构：A overpowers B（A制服B）；Sth overpowers sb（某种感觉/气味等让人难以承受）。
与“power”相关的常见对比：overpower强调“力量压过对方而制服/压倒”；overwhelm更常用于“情绪、任务、数量”上的压倒（也可指感受被淹没）。

summary.en: Overpractice means practicing too much, often causing fatigue, stress, worse performance, or injury.
summary.zh: Overpractice 指练得过多，常会导致疲劳、压力、表现变差或受伤。

definition.en: to practice something too much, especially so that it causes tiredness, stress, worse performance, or injury
definition.zh: 过度练习；练得太多（以至于导致疲劳、压力、表现变差或受伤）

examples.en: If you overpractice before the recital, your hands may feel stiff and shaky.
examples.zh: 如果你在演奏会前过度练习，手可能会变得僵硬、发抖。

examples.en: The coach warned the team not to overpractice during exam week.
examples.zh: 教练提醒队员在考试周不要过度训练。

examples.en: She overpracticed the difficult passage and ended up making more mistakes.
examples.zh: 她对那段难句过度练习，结果反而错得更多。

definition.en: the act or habit of practicing too much
definition.zh: 过度练习（这一行为或习惯）

examples.en: Overpractice can lead to burnout for musicians and athletes.
examples.zh: 过度练习会让音乐学习者和运动员产生倦怠。

examples.en: His teacher said the problem wasn’t talent—it was overpractice without rest.
examples.zh: 老师说问题不在天赋，而在于不休息的过度练习。

extraExplanation: “overpractice”在日常英语里不算非常常见，但在音乐学习、体育训练、语言备考等语境中很实用。更常见的表达还有：practice too much、overtrain（偏运动）、overdo it。
与“overpractice”相关的常见后果表达：fatigue（疲劳）、burnout（倦怠）、overuse injury（过度使用造成的伤）、diminishing returns（边际收益递减：越练越不划算）。

summary.en: Overpracticed means practiced too much, so it seems stiff or unnatural.
summary.zh: overpracticed 指练习过度，以至于显得僵硬、不自然。

definition.en: Practiced so much that it feels unnatural, stiff, or less effective; over-rehearsed.
definition.zh: 练得过头而显得不自然、僵硬或效果变差的；过度排练的。

examples.en: Her smile looked overpracticed, like she’d rehearsed it in the mirror.
examples.zh: 她的笑容看起来练得过头，有点像在镜子前排练过一样。

examples.en: The presentation sounded overpracticed and lost its warmth.
examples.zh: 这场演讲听起来过度练习，少了温度和真诚。

examples.en: Try not to make your interview answers feel overpracticed—keep them natural.
examples.zh: 面试回答尽量别显得背得太熟，保持自然更好。

extraExplanation: “over-”在英语里常表示“过度、超过适当程度”。所以 overpracticed 通常带一点负面含义：不是“很熟练”，而是“熟练到显得刻意、不真诚或机械”。更常见的近义表达还有 over-rehearsed / too rehearsed。

summary.en: Overpracticing means practicing too much—so much that it becomes unhealthy or reduces performance.
summary.zh: overpracticing 指“过度练习”，练得太多而导致不健康、受伤或表现变差。

definition.en: (noun/gerund) The act of practicing something too much, so it causes harm such as fatigue, injury, burnout, or worse performance.
definition.zh: （名词/动名词）过度练习；练得太多，以至于带来负面影响，如疲劳、受伤、倦怠或表现变差。

examples.en: Overpracticing can lead to injury, especially for young athletes.
examples.zh: 过度练习可能导致受伤，尤其是对年轻运动员来说。

examples.en: Her teacher warned her that overpracticing the same passage could make it sound stiff.
examples.zh: 老师提醒她，反复过度练同一段可能会让演奏听起来僵硬。

examples.en: He took a rest day to recover from overpracticing.
examples.zh: 他休息了一天来从过度练习中恢复。

definition.en: (verb/present participle) Practicing something excessively (more than is healthy or helpful).
definition.zh: （动词/现在分词）正在过度练习（超过健康或有效的程度）。

examples.en: If you’re overpracticing, your body may feel sore all the time.
examples.zh: 如果你正在过度练习，你的身体可能会一直酸痛。

examples.en: She realized she was overpracticing and scheduled shorter sessions.
examples.zh: 她意识到自己在过度练习，于是把练习安排得更短。

definition.en: (adjective) Related to or caused by too much practice.
definition.zh: （形容词）与过度练习有关的；由过度练习引起的。

examples.en: He developed an overpracticing injury in his wrist.
examples.zh: 他的手腕出现了过度练习导致的伤。

examples.en: They discussed overpracticing habits and how to prevent burnout.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了过度练习的习惯以及如何预防倦怠。

extraExplanation: “over-”这个前缀表示“过度、超过适当程度”（如 overwork 过劳、overeat 暴饮暴食）。因此 overpracticing 往往带有“适得其反”的含义：练得越多，不一定越好。
常见语境：音乐练习（piano/violin）、运动训练（sports training）、考试备考（studying）。常见搭配：overpracticing injuries（过度练习伤）、risk of overpracticing（过度练习风险）、avoid overpracticing（避免过度练习）。
也可写作 over-practicing（较少见）。更常见的基础形式是动词 overpractice（过度练习），名词形式也可说 overpractice。

summary.en: Overpraise means praising someone or something too much, or the excessive praise itself.
summary.zh: Overpraise 指“过度称赞”，既可作名词表示“过度的赞美”，也可作动词表示“过分夸奖”。

definition.en: Excessive praise; praise that is more enthusiastic than is deserved or appropriate.
definition.zh: 过度的赞美；不恰当地夸奖（超过应有程度的称赞）。

examples.en: The article was full of overpraise, making the product sound perfect.
examples.zh: 这篇文章充满了过度赞美，把产品说得完美无缺。

examples.en: Some people felt the award speech turned into overpraise instead of a balanced tribute.
examples.zh: 有些人觉得颁奖致辞变成了过度吹捧，而不是客观的致敬。

definition.en: To praise someone or something too much; to exaggerate how good they are.
definition.zh: 过分称赞；过度夸奖（把优点夸大）。

examples.en: Don’t overpraise him—he still has a lot to learn.
examples.zh: 别过度夸他——他还有很多要学。

examples.en: It’s easy to overpraise a new restaurant after one good meal.
examples.zh: 只因为一顿饭吃得不错，就很容易把新餐厅夸得过头。

extraExplanation: “overpraise”通常带有轻微负面含义：暗示赞美不够客观，可能是在“吹捧/捧杀”。在正式写作中也常用更常见的表达，如“excessive praise”“overly generous praise”。
与“compliment”相比，“praise”更常用于公开或正式场合（如演讲、评价、报道）；“overpraise”因此常见于评论、媒体或职场语境中。

summary.en: “Overpraised” means something has received too much praise and may not deserve such high admiration.
summary.zh: “Overpraised”指某事物被过度称赞，赞美程度可能超过其实际水平或应得程度。

definition.en: praised too much; given more admiration or credit than is deserved.
definition.zh: 被过度称赞的；赞美过头、超过应得程度的。

examples.en: Some viewers felt the movie was overpraised and not as original as people claimed.
examples.zh: 一些观众觉得这部电影被过度吹捧了，并没有人们说的那么有创意。

examples.en: The overpraised product disappointed customers once they tried it.
examples.zh: 这款被过度称赞的产品在顾客实际使用后让人失望。

extraExplanation: “overpraised”由前缀 over-（“过度”）+ praised（“被称赞的”）构成，常用来表达一种温和或带批评意味的反驳：别人夸得太多，而你认为事实没那么好。
语气上比“bad/terrible”更克制，重点不在“东西很差”，而在“评价与实际不匹配”。

summary.en: “Overpraises” means “praises too much”; it’s usually the third-person singular of the verb “overpraise.”
summary.zh: “overpraises”表示“过度称赞”，通常是动词“overpraise”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to praise someone or something too much, often more than is deserved
definition.zh: 过度称赞；把人或事夸得太过（往往超过其应得）

examples.en: The coach warned parents not to overpraise their kids after every small success.
examples.zh: 教练提醒家长不要在孩子每次小小的成功后都过度称赞。

examples.en: If you overpraise the product, customers may feel disappointed when they try it.
examples.zh: 如果你把产品夸得太过，顾客试用后可能会感到失望。

definition.en: the act of praising too much
definition.zh: 过度赞美；过分夸奖

examples.en: Too much overpraise can make feedback feel unrealistic.
examples.zh: 过多的过度赞美会让反馈显得不真实。

extraExplanation: “overpraises”通常是动词“overpraise”的第三人称单数形式：He/She overpraises…（他/她过度称赞……）。
语气上，“overpraise”带有轻微批评，暗示赞美失衡，可能导致对方骄傲、失去动力，或让听者觉得你不真诚。
与“encourage（鼓励）/compliment（称赞）”不同，“overpraise”强调“过度”；更自然的表达还包括：praise too much、lay it on thick（口语：夸得肉麻）。

summary.en: Overpraising means giving too much praise, so it can feel exaggerated or insincere.
summary.zh: overpraising 指“过度称赞/夸奖过头”，容易显得夸张或不真诚。

definition.en: the act of praising someone too much or too often, so it feels exaggerated or insincere. Example: She worried her overpraising would make the kids stop taking feedback seriously. / Example: The review was so full of overpraising that readers didn’t trust it.
definition.zh: 过度称赞；过分夸奖（称赞太多或太频繁，以至于显得夸张或不真诚）。例：她担心自己过度称赞会让孩子不再认真对待建议。/ 例：那篇评论夸得太过头，读者反而不信了。

examples.en: She worried her overpraising would make the kids stop taking feedback seriously.
examples.zh: 她担心自己过度称赞会让孩子不再认真对待建议。

examples.en: The article’s overpraising made the endorsement feel fake.
examples.zh: 文章里过度的赞美让这份背书显得很假。

definition.en: praising someone too much; giving more praise than is deserved. Example: Overpraising employees for small tasks can weaken the meaning of real recognition. / Example: He sounded like he was overpraising the product to sell it.
definition.zh: 过度称赞的；夸奖过头的（给出的赞美超过应有程度）。例：为小事过度表扬员工，会削弱真正认可的分量。/ 例：他听起来像是在为推销而把产品夸上天。

examples.en: Overpraising can make honest compliments lose their power.
examples.zh: 过度称赞会让真诚的赞美失去力量。

examples.en: He apologized for overpraising her work in public.
examples.zh: 他为在公开场合把她的作品夸得太过而道歉。

extraExplanation: “over-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“过度、超过正常范围”（如 overeat 吃太多、overwork 过劳）。因此 overpraise/overpraising 通常带有轻微负面含义：不是反对称赞本身，而是强调“称赞过量会降低可信度或让人有压力”。
在职场或教育场景中，英语里常提到“specific praise（具体的表扬）”比“general praise（泛泛的夸奖）”更有效：与其 overpraising（夸到失真），不如指出具体行为或成果。

summary.en: Overpraise means praising someone or something too much (also used as a noun for excessive praise).
summary.zh: overpraise 指“过度称赞/过分夸奖”，也可作名词表示“过度的赞美”。

definition.en: to praise someone or something too much, more than is deserved
definition.zh: 过度称赞；把某人或某事夸得过头（超过其应得程度）

examples.en: The movie was good, but critics may have overpraised it.
examples.zh: 这部电影不错，但影评人可能把它夸过头了。

examples.en: Don’t overpraise children for every small thing; focus on effort and progress.
examples.zh: 不要为每件小事都过度表扬孩子；更应关注努力和进步。

definition.en: excessive praise; praise that is too strong or too frequent
definition.zh: 过度的赞美；夸大其词的称赞

examples.en: His speech was full of overpraise for the company’s “perfect” record.
examples.zh: 他的演讲里充满了对公司“完美”业绩的过度吹捧。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“overprase”很可能是拼写错误，更常见的拼写是“overpraise”。
词根提示：over- 表示“过度”，praise 表示“赞美”。合起来就是“过度赞美/夸奖”。
语气与使用场景：overpraise 常带一点批评意味，暗示赞美不客观，甚至可能让人反感或造成压力。

summary.en: Overpraised means praised too much.
summary.zh: Overpraised 指“被过度称赞”。

definition.en: praised too much; described as better or more important than it really is
definition.zh: 被过度称赞的；被夸大其优点的

examples.en: I think that restaurant is overpraised—it's good, but not amazing.
examples.zh: 我觉得那家餐厅被过度吹捧了——不错，但没那么惊艳。

examples.en: The movie was overpraised by critics, so my expectations were too high.
examples.zh: 那部电影被影评人过度称赞，所以我期望值太高了。

definition.en: to praise someone or something too much
definition.zh: 过度称赞（某人或某物）

examples.en: Try not to overpraise children for every small thing; focus on specific effort.
examples.zh: 别为每件小事都过度表扬孩子；更适合强调具体的努力。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 “overprased” 很可能是拼写错误，标准拼写通常是 “overpraised”（over- + praised）。
“overpraised” 常用来表达一种“被吹捧得名不副实”的感觉，语气通常偏批评或纠正期待值。

summary.en: Overpraise means to praise too much or more than someone or something deserves.
summary.zh: Overpraise 指“过度称赞”，即夸奖过头、超过应得程度。

definition.en: To praise someone or something too much, often more than is deserved.
definition.zh: 过度称赞；把某人或某事夸得过头（常指超过其应得程度）。

examples.en: People sometimes overpraise children for small things, which can make feedback less meaningful later.
examples.zh: 人们有时会为孩子的小事过度称赞，这可能会让之后的反馈变得不那么有意义。

examples.en: The movie is fun, but some reviews overpraise it as a masterpiece.
examples.zh: 这部电影很有趣，但有些影评把它过度吹捧成“杰作”。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“overprases”很可能是拼写错误；常见正确拼写是 overpraise（动词），意为“过度称赞”。
over- 这个前缀常表示“过度、超过正常程度”，例如 overeat（吃太多）、overwork（过度工作）、overreact（反应过度）。
语气上 overpraise 往往带一点批评意味：并不是单纯“表扬”，而是认为表扬得不恰当或不够客观。

summary.en: Overpraise means to praise someone or something too much.
summary.zh: overpraise 指“过度称赞/夸得过头”。

definition.en: to praise someone or something too much, in a way that feels exaggerated or not fully deserved
definition.zh: 过度称赞；把某人或某事夸得过头（让人觉得夸张或不完全符合事实）

examples.en: The teacher worried that overpraising would make students stop trying as hard.
examples.zh: 老师担心过度称赞会让学生不再那么努力。

examples.en: It’s kind to encourage people, but overpraising can sound insincere.
examples.zh: 鼓励别人当然很好，但夸得过头可能会显得不真诚。

examples.en: The article was so positive that some readers felt it was overpraising the product.
examples.zh: 那篇文章太正面了，以至于有些读者觉得是在过度吹捧产品。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“overprasing”更常见的拼写是 **overpraising**（来自动词 **overpraise**）。如果你想表达“价格定得过高”，对应的是 **overpricing** / 动词 **overprice**。
语气提示：**overpraise** 常带轻微负面含义，强调“夸得不合适、让人尴尬或显得假”。想更中性，可以用 **give a lot of praise**（给很多表扬）或 **be very complimentary**（高度赞美）。

summary.en: Overpractice means practicing too much, often causing fatigue, injury, or worse performance.
summary.zh: overpractice 指“过度练习”，常导致疲劳、受伤或表现变差。

definition.en: to practice something too much, so that you become tired, stressed, injured, or your performance gets worse
definition.zh: 过度练习；练得太多（以至于疲劳、压力、受伤或表现反而变差）

examples.en: If you overpractice the piano piece, your hands may get tense and the music can sound stiff.
examples.zh: 如果你把那首钢琴曲练过头，手可能会紧绷，音乐听起来也会变得僵硬。

examples.en: She overpracticed before the audition and felt exhausted on the day.
examples.zh: 她在试镜前练得过度，结果当天精疲力尽。

definition.en: the act or habit of practicing too much
definition.zh: 过度练习（这一行为或习惯）

examples.en: Overpractice can increase the risk of sports injuries.
examples.zh: 过度练习会增加运动受伤的风险。

examples.en: The coach warned the team about overpractice and burnout.
examples.zh: 教练提醒队员要避免过度练习和倦怠。

extraExplanation: 你输入的拼写是 **overpratice**，更常见、正确的拼写是 **overpractice**（中间是 *-ct-*）。
这个词在音乐训练、体育训练、备考等语境里很常见，常和 **burnout（倦怠）**、**strain（拉伤/过度用力）**、**injury（受伤）**、**plateau（瓶颈期）** 搭配使用。
学习/训练建议：强调“高质量练习”而不是“练得越久越好”，常见做法包括分段练习、间隔休息、交替训练不同技能。

summary.en: Overpracticed means practiced so much that it feels unnatural or stiff.
summary.zh: Overpracticed 指练得太多，以至于显得不自然或僵硬。

definition.en: (Usually of a skill, performance, or piece of work) practiced so much that it starts to sound or feel unnatural, stiff, or less fresh.
definition.zh: （常指技能、表演或作品）练得太多，以至于听起来/感觉不自然、僵硬或缺少新鲜感。

examples.en: The speech sounded overpracticed, like he was reading from a script.
examples.zh: 这段演讲听起来练得太过头了，好像在照着稿子念。

examples.en: Her smile looked overpracticed for the camera.
examples.zh: 她对着镜头的笑容看起来太“练习过头”了。

examples.en: The band’s performance was technically perfect but a bit overpracticed.
examples.zh: 乐队的演奏技术上很完美，但有点练得过头、少了点灵气。

extraExplanation: 更常见的拼写是 overpracticed（美式）或 overpractised（英式）。你输入的 overpraticed 里把 “c” 和 “t” 的位置写错了。
overpracticed 带有轻微的负面评价：不是说“勤奋”不好，而是强调“太熟练到显得做作/机械”，常用于演讲、表演、笑容、回答等。

summary.en: Overpracticing means practicing too much, often causing fatigue, stress, injury, or worse performance.
summary.zh: Overpracticing 指过度练习，常导致疲劳、压力、受伤或表现下降。

definition.en: practicing (training/rehearsing) too much, to the point that it causes fatigue, boredom, stress, or worse performance.
definition.zh: 过度练习；练得太多，以至于造成疲劳、厌倦、压力，甚至表现变差。

examples.en: Overpracticing the piano can lead to sore hands and less control.
examples.zh: 钢琴过度练习可能会导致手酸痛、控制力下降。

examples.en: If you feel anxious before the game, overpracticing might be part of the problem.
examples.zh: 如果你在比赛前感到焦虑，过度练习可能是原因之一。

examples.en: Her coach warned that overpracticing can cause injuries.
examples.zh: 她的教练警告说，过度练习会导致受伤。

definition.en: the act of doing something too much in practice or rehearsal (often used in sports, music, studying, etc.).
definition.zh: （在运动、音乐、学习等方面）练习过量这件事（常指一种做法或现象）。

examples.en: Overpracticing is common before auditions, but rest is part of training.
examples.zh: 试音前过度练习很常见，但休息也是训练的一部分。

examples.en: They discussed overpracticing and burnout in the workshop.
examples.zh: 他们在工作坊里讨论了过度练习与倦怠。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“overpraticing”常见是拼写错误；标准拼写是 **overpracticing**（美式）或 **overpractising**（英式）。
这是由前缀 **over-**（“过度”）+ **practicing**（练习）组成，语感上强调“多到不合适”。
在日常表达里也常用动词短语：**practice too much**（练得太多）、**overdo practice**（把练习做过头）。

summary.en: Overpray means to pray excessively—so much that it becomes unhelpful, inappropriate, or burdensome.
summary.zh: overpray 指“过度祈祷”，祈祷多到不再有帮助、显得不合时宜，或让人感到压力。

definition.en: to pray too much or in an excessive way (more than is helpful, appropriate, or sincere)
definition.zh: 过度祈祷；祈祷得太多（多到不再有帮助、不合时宜或显得不真诚）

examples.en: When I feel anxious, I can overpray instead of taking practical steps.
examples.zh: 当我感到焦虑时，我可能会过度祈祷，而不是采取实际行动。

examples.en: He worried that he might overpray and forget to listen quietly.
examples.zh: 他担心自己会祈祷过头，却忘了安静聆听。

definition.en: to pray over something too intensely or too often; to burden a situation with excessive religious language
definition.zh: 对某事过度祈祷；在某种情境中反复、强烈地“加码”祷告（让场面充满过多宗教化表达）

examples.en: Some guests felt uncomfortable because the host seemed to overpray the meal.
examples.zh: 有些客人觉得不自在，因为主人对这顿饭的祷告似乎过度了。

examples.en: Try not to overpray every decision—talk, plan, and then pray.
examples.zh: 别对每个决定都过度祈祷——先沟通、计划，然后再祷告。

extraExplanation: “over-”这个前缀常表示“过度、超过适当程度”（如 overeat 吃太多、overthink 想太多）。因此 overpray 多用于提醒：祈祷本身是正面的，但如果变成逃避行动、替代沟通、或在社交场合让他人感到压力，就可能被认为是“过度”。
该词在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是 pray too much / excessive praying。使用 overpray 时，语气往往带一点自我反省或温和批评。

summary.en: To overpreach is to preach or moralize too much, often in an annoying or lecturing way.
summary.zh: overpreach 指“过度说教”，讲道理或灌输观点讲得太多，令人反感或像被训话。

definition.en: to preach or give moral advice too much, in a way that feels excessive, lecturing, or annoying
definition.zh: 过度说教；讲道理讲得太多（让人觉得烦、被训话）

examples.en: I agree with your point—just don’t overpreach and lose your audience.
examples.zh: 我同意你的观点——只是别过度说教，把听众弄烦了。

examples.en: The film has a good message, but it overpreaches in the final scenes.
examples.zh: 这部电影立意很好，但最后几场有点过度说教。

extraExplanation: “over-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“过度、超出适度范围”（如 overeat 吃太多、overwork 过劳）。因此 overpreach 通常带一点负面语气，暗示内容不是“有道理”，而是“讲得太多、太像训人”。
preach 本义是“布道/传道”，在日常语境里也常指“把自己的道德观或观点强加给别人”。overpreach 就是在这个语气上再加强：不仅在讲道理，而且讲得过头。

summary.en: Overprecise means unnecessarily exact or picky about small details.
summary.zh: overprecise 指“过分精确、过于挑剔细节”，精确到不必要的程度。

definition.en: Too precise or exact in a way that is unnecessary, fussy, or unhelpful (often focusing on tiny details instead of the main point).
definition.zh: 过分精确的；吹毛求疵的（把不必要的小细节看得太重，反而不利于表达或解决问题）。

examples.en: Your answer is overprecise—just tell me the general idea.
examples.zh: 你的回答太过精确了——告诉我大概意思就行。

examples.en: The instructions are so overprecise that new users feel overwhelmed.
examples.zh: 说明写得过分精细，导致新用户感到压力很大。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度”，常带负面含义（如 overthink 想太多、overreact 反应过度）。因此 overprecise 往往是在批评：精确本身是优点，但“过分精确”会显得不合时宜、拖慢效率或让沟通变难。
语气与场合：多用于日常或学术/工作场景的评价，语气偏委婉但明确；若想更中性，可说 “very detailed” 或 “highly specific”。

summary.en: “Overprecisely” means ‘too precisely’—more exact or detailed than needed.
summary.zh: “overprecisely”表示“过于精确地”，精确或细节超过了必要程度。

definition.en: In a way that is too exact or detailed, more precise than is necessary or helpful.
definition.zh: 过于精确地；精确到不必要或不实用的程度。

examples.en: He explained the rules overprecisely, and the main point got lost.
examples.zh: 他把规则讲得过于精确，反而让重点被淹没了。

examples.en: The report describes the process overprecisely for a general audience.
examples.zh: 这份报告对一般读者来说把流程描述得过于精确（细到不需要）。

extraExplanation: “over-”常表示“过度、超过适当程度”。“overprecisely”是由 over- + precisely 构成，意思不是“非常精确”（那更常用 very/quite extremely precisely），而是“精确过头，反而不合适”。
在写作或口语中，它常带轻微负面评价：暗示说话/写作者太纠结细节，影响理解或效率。

summary.en: Overpreciseness means unnecessary or excessive precision that can make things less efficient or clear.
summary.zh: Overpreciseness 指不必要的过度精确，可能让事情变得更低效或不够清楚。

definition.en: the quality of being too precise or detailed, especially when it is unnecessary and makes communication or decisions harder
definition.zh: 过度精确（性）；过分追求细节的特质（尤指不必要地过于精细，反而让沟通或决策更困难）

examples.en: His overpreciseness slowed the meeting because he kept correcting tiny details.
examples.zh: 他过度精确的作风拖慢了会议，因为他不停纠正细枝末节。

examples.en: In everyday conversation, a little flexibility is often better than overpreciseness.
examples.zh: 在日常对话中，适度灵活往往比过度精确更好。

extraExplanation: “overpreciseness”在现代英语里不算常见，更自然的说法常是“overprecision”或直接说“being overly/too precise”。
构词上是 over-（过度）+ precise（精确的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的状态/性质”）。带有轻微批评意味，常暗示“精确到不合时宜”。

summary.en: Overprecision means being too exact or detailed in a way that isn’t necessary for the situation.
summary.zh: overprecision 指在不需要的情况下过分追求精确或细节。

definition.en: Excessive exactness in details (such as measurements, wording, or rules) beyond what the situation really needs; being “too precise.”
definition.zh: 过度精确；对细节（如数据、措辞或规则）要求过分严格，超过情境所需。

examples.en: The report suffered from overprecision: it listed every decimal place, but it didn’t explain the main trend.
examples.zh: 这份报告的问题是过度精确：小数点后列了一大堆，但没有解释主要趋势。

examples.en: In everyday conversation, overprecision can sound unfriendly or pedantic.
examples.zh: 在日常对话中，过度精确可能显得不友好或卖弄学问。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、超出正常范围”（如 overwork 过度工作、overthink 想太多）。因此 overprecision 字面意思就是“超出需要的精确”。
overprecision 常用于批评语气，强调“精确本身不是坏事，但在这个场景里不划算/不合适”，尤其在沟通、写作、数据呈现与政策执行中常见。
更常见的近义表达包括：excessive precision（过度精确）、needless precision（不必要的精确）、hair-splitting（吹毛求疵）、nitpicking（挑刺）。

summary.en: “Overpreface” means to overdo the introduction before getting to the main point.
summary.zh: “overpreface”指在进入正题前把开场/前言说得过多、过长。

definition.en: To give too long, too detailed, or unnecessary introductory remarks before the main point (to overdo a preface).
definition.zh: 在进入正题前说了过多、过长或不必要的开场/铺垫（把“前言”说过头）。

examples.en: Sorry to overpreface, but I want to explain why I’m bringing this up.
examples.zh: 不好意思我有点开场说太多了，但我想先解释一下我为什么要提这件事。

examples.en: He tends to overpreface his questions with long stories.
examples.zh: 他常常在提问前先讲很长的故事，等于把开场铺垫说过头。

extraExplanation: “overpreface”并不是常见词，更多属于罕见/自造式用法（在写作或口语里用来幽默地表示“前置说明太多”）。日常更自然的说法通常是："give too much preface"、"over-explain"、"ramble before getting to the point"。

summary.en: A rare, literary adjective meaning “very/heavily pregnant,” often implying late pregnancy.
summary.zh: 一个罕见的文学形容词，意思是“怀得很大/临近分娩（怀孕后期）”。

definition.en: (Rare, literary) Very pregnant; heavily pregnant, especially close to giving birth.
definition.zh: （罕见/文学用语）怀孕很久、肚子很大；临近分娩的“很显怀/快生了”。

examples.en: By late summer she was overpregnant and moved more slowly through the orchard.
examples.zh: 到夏末时她已经怀得很大，在果园里走得更慢了。

examples.en: The novel describes an overpregnant heroine who is both hopeful and exhausted.
examples.zh: 小说描写了一位临近分娩的女主角，既充满希望又疲惫不堪。

synonyms: in the late stages of pregnancy
extraExplanation: “overpregnant”在现代英语里非常少见，多见于旧文学或仿古/诗意写法，用来强调“怀得很大、快要生”。日常表达更常用：heavily pregnant, very pregnant, in the late stages of pregnancy, close to giving birth。
构词上是 over-（“过度/非常”）+ pregnant（怀孕的），语气带强调，但并不常见于正式医疗或现代新闻用语。使用时注意语境，避免显得刻意或不自然。

summary.en: Overpreoccupation means an excessive, often unhealthy, focus or concern about something.
summary.zh: overpreoccupation 指对某事过度关注或不健康的执着。

definition.en: Excessive or unhealthy focus on something; being too concerned or absorbed in one topic or worry.
definition.zh: 对某事的过度关注或不健康的执着；过分担心或沉迷于某一问题。

examples.en: His overpreoccupation with grades made it hard for him to enjoy learning.
examples.zh: 他对成绩的过度关注让他很难真正享受学习。

examples.en: An overpreoccupation with body image can harm mental health.
examples.zh: 对身材外貌的过度执着可能会损害心理健康。

examples.en: The report warns that overpreoccupation with short-term profits can weaken long-term planning.
examples.zh: 报告警告说，过度关注短期利润会削弱长期规划。

extraExplanation: 构词提示：over- 表示“过度/过分”，preoccupation 表示“专注、挂念、心事”。合在一起就是“过度挂念/过度专注”。
用法提示：overpreoccupation 多用于较正式的书面语；口语里更常说 “be too preoccupied with … / be obsessed with … / worry too much about …”。

summary.en: Overpreoccupied means excessively preoccupied—so focused on something that it affects other parts of life.
summary.zh: Overpreoccupied 指“过度专注/过分挂念”，专注到影响生活的其他方面。

definition.en: Too focused on something; excessively absorbed so that you may neglect other things.
definition.zh: 过度专注于某事；过分沉浸，以至于可能忽略其他事情。

examples.en: He became overpreoccupied with his grades and stopped sleeping enough.
examples.zh: 他对成绩过度在意，结果睡眠严重不足。

examples.en: If you’re overpreoccupied with what others think, it’s hard to enjoy the moment.
examples.zh: 如果你过度在意别人的看法，就很难享受当下。

extraExplanation: “over-”这个前缀常表示“过度、超出合理范围”（如 overwork 过度工作、overthink 想太多）。因此 overpreoccupied 强调“比一般的 preoccupied（心事重重/专注到分心）更严重”。
这个词相对不常见，日常表达里更常用 very/excessively preoccupied，或用 overfocused / obsessed（语气更强）替代。

summary.en: Overpreoccupy means to occupy someone’s mind too much.
summary.zh: overpreoccupy 指过度占据某人的心思、让人过分挂念。

definition.en: to take up too much of someone’s attention or mental energy; to occupy the mind excessively.
definition.zh: 过度占据（某人的）注意力或心力；让人想得太多、太在意。

examples.en: Don’t let one mistake overpreoccupy you—learn from it and move on.
examples.zh: 别让一次失误过度占据你的心思——从中学习，然后继续前进。

examples.en: She was overpreoccupied with what others thought, so she couldn’t relax.
examples.zh: 她过度在意别人怎么想，所以一直放松不下来。

examples.en: The news overpreoccupied him for days, even during work.
examples.zh: 那条新闻让他好几天都心神不宁，甚至工作时也在想。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太……”，加在“preoccupy（使先占据心思；使挂念）”前面，强调“超出正常程度的挂念/占据注意力”。
这个词在日常英语里不算常见；更常用的说法是“be too preoccupied (with…) / be overly preoccupied (with…) / obsess over… / fixate on…”。语气从中性到更强烈不等。

summary.en: “Overpreoccupying” means excessively attention-consuming or worry-inducing; it can also describe the action of occupying someone’s mind too much.
summary.zh: “overpreoccupying”指过度耗费注意力、让人过分挂念；也可表示“使某人过度分心/挂念”的动作。

definition.en: Taking up too much of someone’s attention or mental energy; making someone think about something more than is healthy or helpful.
definition.zh: 过度占据（某人）注意力或心力的；让人想得太多、以至于不健康或无益的。

examples.en: Worry about one mistake can be overpreoccupying and stop you from learning.
examples.zh: 一直担心一次失误可能会过度占据你的心思，反而阻碍学习。

examples.en: The news became overpreoccupying, so she limited her screen time.
examples.zh: 新闻让她过度分心，所以她限制了看屏幕的时间。

definition.en: Present participle of “overpreoccupy”: to absorb or occupy (someone) too much; to cause excessive preoccupation.
definition.zh: “overpreoccupy”的现在分词：过度占用（某人）的注意力；使（某人）过分挂念。

examples.en: Constant comparisons are overpreoccupying him with other people’s opinions.
examples.zh: 不断的比较让他过度在意别人的看法。

examples.en: Try not to let small setbacks keep overpreoccupying your mind.
examples.zh: 尽量别让小挫折一直过度占据你的思绪。

extraExplanation: “overpreoccupying”并不算常见词，更自然的表达通常是：too preoccupying / overly preoccupying / mentally consuming / all-consuming / distracting。
构词：over-（过度）+ preoccupy（使分心/使挂念）+ -ing（现在分词/形容词用法）。在写作中用它会显得较“学术”或较生硬，口语里建议用更常见的替代说法。

summary.en: Overprescribe means to prescribe medicine excessively or more than is medically necessary.
summary.zh: Overprescribe 指“过度开药/开处方”，即开药量或频率超过医学上必要的程度。

definition.en: to prescribe too much medicine, or to prescribe a medicine too often or in unnecessarily strong amounts
definition.zh: 过度开药；开药过多（次数、剂量或强度不必要地过量）

examples.en: Some doctors worry that painkillers are sometimes overprescribed after minor surgery.
examples.zh: 一些医生担心，止痛药在小手术后有时会被过度开具。

examples.en: The report found that antibiotics were overprescribed for colds, which are usually caused by viruses.
examples.zh: 报告发现，抗生素常被用于感冒而被过度开具，但感冒通常由病毒引起。

definition.en: to give someone more prescriptions than they need (especially repeatedly over time)
definition.zh: （对某人）反复开出超过其需要的处方

examples.en: If a clinic overprescribes to the same patients, it may face an investigation.
examples.zh: 如果一家诊所对同一批病人反复过度开处方，可能会面临调查。

extraExplanation: 在英语语境里，overprescribe 常见于公共健康与医疗政策讨论，尤其涉及抗生素滥用（会增加耐药性）以及阿片类止痛药的过度处方（与成瘾风险相关）。
词形上是 over-（过度）+ prescribe（开处方），强调“超出合理需要/标准”的开药，而不只是“开了药”。

summary.en: “Overprescribed” describes medicine that is prescribed too often or in excessive amounts.
summary.zh: overprescribed 指药物被过度开具（开得过多或过频）。

definition.en: Prescribed too often or in larger amounts than is medically necessary or safe.
definition.zh: （药物等）被过度开具的；开得过多/过频，超过医疗必要或安全范围。

examples.en: Some painkillers were overprescribed in the past, leading to serious health problems.
examples.zh: 过去一些止痛药被过度开具，导致了严重的健康问题。

examples.en: The report warns that antibiotics are often overprescribed for colds.
examples.zh: 报告警告说，抗生素常被用于感冒而遭到过度开具。

definition.en: Past form of “overprescribe”: to prescribe (a medicine) too often or too much.
definition.zh: “overprescribe”的过去式/过去分词：过度开具（药物），开得太多或太频繁。

examples.en: Doctors overprescribed strong opioids for minor injuries.
examples.zh: 医生为轻微伤开了过多的强效阿片类止痛药。

examples.en: The clinic admitted it had overprescribed antibiotics last winter.
examples.zh: 诊所承认去年冬天抗生素开得过多。

extraExplanation: 这个词常出现在公共卫生与医疗新闻里，尤其与“抗生素滥用（antibiotic overuse）”“阿片类药物危机（opioid crisis）”等话题相关。过度开具抗生素会增加耐药风险；过度开具止痛药可能带来依赖、成瘾或过量等问题。

summary.en: “Overprescribes” means gives too many or too-strong prescriptions, especially medicines.
summary.zh: “overprescribes”指（尤其在医疗中）过度开处方：开药过多、剂量过高或不必要。

definition.en: to prescribe too much medicine, too high a dose, or more treatments than are necessary (often causing risk or side effects)
definition.zh: （医生）过度开药；开出过多、过高剂量或不必要的治疗（常会带来风险或副作用）

examples.en: Some doctors worry that the system overprescribes antibiotics for colds.
examples.zh: 一些医生担心医疗系统对感冒过度开抗生素。

examples.en: If a clinic overprescribes painkillers, patients can become dependent.
examples.zh: 如果诊所过度开止痛药，病人可能会产生依赖。

examples.en: This guideline helps physicians avoid overprescribing to older adults.
examples.zh: 这份指南帮助医生避免对老年人过度开药。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、超过合理范围”，加在动词前构成新词，如 overeat（吃太多）、overwork（过度工作）。
overprescribe 多用于医疗与公共健康语境，常见搭配：overprescribe antibiotics / opioids / painkillers（过度开抗生素/阿片类药物/止痛药）。
语法提醒：overprescribes 是第三人称单数（he/she/it overprescribes）。原形是 overprescribe；过去式/过去分词是 overprescribed。

summary.en: Overprescribing means giving medicines too often or unnecessarily, or in too high a dose.
summary.zh: Overprescribing 指过度开药：开得过于频繁、不必要，或剂量过大。

definition.en: (of a doctor or other prescriber) prescribing a medicine too often, in doses that are too high, or when it is not really needed.
definition.zh: （医生或处方者）过度开药；开药过多、剂量过大，或在并非真正需要时开药。

examples.en: Overprescribing antibiotics can make infections harder to treat in the future.
examples.zh: 过度开抗生素会让未来的感染更难治疗。

examples.en: The clinic changed its guidelines to reduce overprescribing of opioid painkillers.
examples.zh: 诊所调整了指南，以减少阿片类止痛药的过度处方。

examples.en: Some patients ask for strong medicine, but overprescribing can do more harm than good.
examples.zh: 有些病人会要求更强的药，但过度开药可能弊大于利。

definition.en: The practice or problem of prescribing medicines too much or unnecessarily.
definition.zh: 过度处方（现象/问题）；指开药过多或不必要的做法。

examples.en: Overprescribing is a major concern in many healthcare systems.
examples.zh: 过度处方在许多医疗体系中都是一个重要问题。

examples.en: The report links overprescribing to higher costs and more side effects.
examples.zh: 报告指出过度处方会导致更高成本和更多副作用。

extraExplanation: “overprescribing”常出现在公共卫生语境中：例如抗生素的过度处方会推动“抗生素耐药性”（细菌变得不怕药），阿片类止痛药的过度处方在美国也与成瘾与用药风险的讨论相关。
词形上由 over-（过度）+ prescribing（开处方）组成；常见搭配：overprescribing antibiotics/opioids; reduce/curb overprescribing（减少/遏制过度处方）。

summary.en: Overpress means to press too hard or to make pressure exceed a safe/intended level.
summary.zh: overpress 指用力过度按压，或（技术语境）使压力超过安全/预期水平。

definition.en: to press something too hard or with too much force, often causing damage or distortion
definition.zh: 对某物用力过度地按压/挤压，常导致损坏或变形

examples.en: Don’t overpress the keyboard keys—they’re designed for a light touch.
examples.zh: 别用力过度按键盘按键——它们设计成轻触即可。

examples.en: If you overpress the dough, the bread can turn dense.
examples.zh: 如果把面团压得太狠，面包可能会变得很扎实（不松软）。

definition.en: (technical) to increase pressure beyond a safe or intended level; to over-pressurize
definition.zh: （技术用语）使压力超过安全或预期水平；使过度加压

examples.en: Overpressing the tank can trigger the safety valve.
examples.zh: 让储罐过度加压可能会触发安全阀。

examples.en: The system shut down automatically to prevent the chamber from being overpressed.
examples.zh: 系统自动关闭，以防止腔体被过度加压。

extraExplanation: “overpress”在日常英语里不算常见，更常用的说法是“press too hard”或更技术化的“overpressurize”。在工程、安全说明中偶尔会看到“overpress(ed)”用来强调“压力超标”。

summary.en: Overpressure means pressure above a normal or reference level, especially in explosions or engineering systems.
summary.zh: Overpressure 指高于正常或参考水平的压力，常用于爆炸冲击波或工程系统的语境。

definition.en: Pressure that is higher than normal atmospheric pressure, or higher than the expected/desired level in a closed system.
definition.zh: 超压；高于正常大气压或高于封闭系统预期/设计水平的压力。

examples.en: The explosion created a powerful overpressure that shattered nearby windows.
examples.zh: 爆炸产生了强大的超压，震碎了附近的窗户。

examples.en: The relief valve opens automatically if overpressure builds up inside the tank.
examples.zh: 如果罐内超压累积，泄压阀会自动开启。

definition.en: Extra pressure above a reference value (often written as “overpressure” or “over-pressure”) in engineering and safety contexts.
definition.zh: （工程/安全语境）相对于参考值的额外压力；常写作 overpressure 或 over-pressure。

examples.en: The pipe was tested at 1.5 times its design pressure to check resistance to overpressure.
examples.zh: 管道按设计压力的1.5倍进行测试，以检查其抗超压能力。

examples.en: Workers wear hearing protection during overpressure tests.
examples.zh: 在超压测试期间，工人会佩戴听力防护用品。

extraExplanation: 在爆炸与冲击波领域，overpressure 常指“冲击波超压”：冲击波到达时，压力瞬间高于环境气压的那一部分（与环境气压的差值）。它常用来评估爆炸对人体与建筑物的伤害风险。
工程里也常见与之搭配的词：design pressure（设计压力）、relief valve（泄压阀/安全阀）、pressure vessel（压力容器）。注意 overpressure 偏“超过正常/允许的压力”，而 high pressure 更泛指“压力很高”，不一定强调“超标”。

summary.en: Overpressures are amounts of pressure above normal—especially above atmospheric pressure—often discussed in explosions and engineering.
summary.zh: overpressures 指“超压/过压”的复数：高于正常（尤其高于大气压）的压力，常用于爆炸冲击波与工程语境。

definition.en: higher-than-normal pressure, especially the pressure above atmospheric pressure (often in explosions, shock waves, or engineering measurements)
definition.zh: 超压；过压（高于正常压力的压力，尤指高于大气压的部分；常见于爆炸冲击波或工程测量）

examples.en: The blast caused dangerous overpressures near the center of the explosion.
examples.zh: 爆炸中心附近产生了危险的超压。

examples.en: Engineers measured overpressure to assess damage to nearby buildings.
examples.zh: 工程师测量超压来评估附近建筑的损坏情况。

examples.en: Even small overpressures can break windows.
examples.zh: 即使不大的超压也可能震碎玻璃。

extraExplanation: overpressures 是 overpressure 的复数形式，常用于描述“不同位置/时刻的多次或多处超压值”。
在爆炸与冲击波语境中，overpressure 往往指“峰值超压”（peak overpressure），也就是冲击波前沿相对大气压的最大增量；常与单位 Pa、kPa、psi 一起出现。
在工程语境里，overpressure 也可泛指系统压力超过设计/允许值的情况（例如容器、管道、燃气系统），但需要结合上下文判断。

summary.en: Overpresumption means excessive presumption—being overly confident or assuming too much.
summary.zh: overpresumption 指“过度的自以为是/过分的擅自假定”，带批评意味。

definition.en: Excessive presumption; too much confidence in one’s own judgment or rights, often showing disrespect for limits or for other people.
definition.zh: 过度的自以为是；过分自信（或自认有权），常带有不尊重界限或他人的意味。

examples.en: His overpresumption made him interrupt everyone and assume he was always right.
examples.zh: 他的过度自以为是让他总是打断别人，并认定自己永远正确。

examples.en: It was overpresumption to think you could fix the problem alone in one day.
examples.zh: 以为你能在一天之内独自解决这个问题，实在是过于自信了。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里不算常见，更常用的是 presumption（自以为是/擅自假定）或 overconfidence（过度自信）。它由前缀 over-（过度）+ presumption 组成，用来强调“过头了”的程度。
语气上，overpresumption 往往带批评意味：不仅是自信，还暗含“越界”“不合时宜的大胆/冒昧”。在正式写作中也可以用 arrogance（傲慢）、hubris（狂妄，常指因自负而招致失败）来表达相近态度。

summary.en: Overly confident in assumptions; too quick to take liberties.
summary.zh: 过度自信地假定；太快就越界、自作主张。

definition.en: Too ready to assume things or take liberties; more presumptive than is appropriate (often implying rude confidence).
definition.zh: 过于武断/擅自；太爱自作主张或越界（常带有冒失、自信过头的语气）。

examples.en: It felt overpresumptive of him to call her by a nickname after meeting once.
examples.zh: 只见过一次他就用昵称叫她，显得太冒失、太擅自了。

examples.en: Don’t be overpresumptive—ask before you change the plan.
examples.zh: 别太自作主张——改计划前先问一下。

examples.en: Her suggestion sounded helpful, but it came off as overpresumptive in that context.
examples.zh: 她的建议本来是好意，但在那种情况下听起来有点越界、太武断。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度”。“presumptive/presumptuous”都与“擅自假定”有关：presumptive更偏“根据一些迹象作推断/假设”，presumptuous更偏“冒昧、无礼地自作主张”。“overpresumptive”在语感上更接近“too presumptuous”，属于较少见、偏口语化/临时组合的形容词。

summary.en: “Overpresumptively” means doing something in an overly confident, assuming, or overly forward way.
summary.zh: “overpresumptively”表示“过分自信、想当然、越界自作主张地”。

definition.en: In a way that is too confident and makes assumptions or takes liberties beyond what is appropriate.
definition.zh: 以过度自信、越界自作主张的方式；过分想当然地。

examples.en: He overpresumptively spoke for the whole team before asking anyone’s opinion.
examples.zh: 他还没问过任何人的意见，就过分想当然地代表整个团队发言。

examples.en: It would be overpresumptively rude to assume you’re invited without checking.
examples.zh: 不确认就以为自己被邀请了，会显得过分自作主张、很失礼。

examples.en: She overpresumptively corrected the professor, even though she wasn’t sure.
examples.zh: 她并不确定却过分自信地纠正教授。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度”；“presumptive”与“presume（想当然、擅自假定）”同源。这个副词很少见，更常见的说法是用“presumptuously（冒昧地、放肆地）”或“too presumptively（太想当然地）”。
语气上，“presumptuously”更强调“冒昧/越界”（社交礼仪层面），而“overpresumptively”更突出“过度、过头”的程度。

summary.en: Overpresumptiveness means being excessively presumptuous—too confident and acting beyond what is appropriate or allowed.
summary.zh: overpresumptiveness 指“过度冒昧/过度自以为是”，即过分自信并做出越界、不合分寸的行为。

definition.en: Excessive presumptuousness; the quality of being too confident and taking liberties (acting as if you have more right, knowledge, or permission than you really do).
definition.zh: 过度的冒昧/自以为是；指过分自信、越界行事，仿佛自己比实际更有权利、资格或把握。

examples.en: His overpresumptiveness annoyed the team because he kept giving orders without being asked.
examples.zh: 他的过度冒昧惹恼了团队，因为他总是在没人要求的情况下发号施令。

examples.en: The teacher corrected her overpresumptiveness and reminded her to listen before speaking.
examples.zh: 老师纠正了她的过度自以为是，并提醒她先听再说。

examples.en: Overpresumptiveness can damage trust, even when your intentions are good.
examples.zh: 即使出发点是好的，过度自以为是也会破坏信任。

extraExplanation: “overpresumptiveness”在现代英语中比较少见，日常更常用的名词是“presumptuousness”（冒昧、自以为是）或“overconfidence”（过度自信）。
词形结构：over-（过度）+ presumptive（想当然的、擅自的）+ -ness（名词后缀）。含义通常偏负面，强调“越界/不合分寸”。

summary.en: Overpresumptuous means excessively presumptuous—too bold or assuming in a way that feels inappropriate or rude.
summary.zh: overpresumptuous 指“过分冒昧/过分自以为是”，在不合适的情况下太大胆、太想当然，显得失礼或越界。

definition.en: Too confident in a way that is rude; taking too many liberties or assuming too much (more than is appropriate).
definition.zh: 过分自以为是（失礼地过于自信）；越界、擅自做主或想当然得太多（超过应有的分寸）。

examples.en: It would be overpresumptuous to tell her how to run her own team.
examples.zh: 告诉她该怎么管理她自己的团队就太过分、太冒昧了。

examples.en: I don’t want to seem overpresumptuous, but may I suggest a different approach?
examples.zh: 我不想显得太冒昧，但我可以建议一种不同的方法吗？

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、超过正常或适当的程度”。因此 overpresumptuous 就是“比 presumptuous（冒昧的、放肆的、自作主张的）还要过头”。
这个词不算常用；日常表达里更常见的是直接说 “too presumptuous” 或 “overly presumptuous”。

summary.en: “Overpresumptuously” means doing or saying something in an overly presumptuous, too-forward way.
summary.zh: “overpresumptuously”表示以过分冒失、过分自以为是的方式说话或做事。

definition.en: In a way that is too confident or too forward, especially by claiming or doing something without enough right, knowledge, or permission.
definition.zh: 以过于自信、过于冒失的方式（尤指在没有足够资格、了解或许可的情况下擅自断言或行动）。

examples.en: He spoke overpresumptuously, as if he knew everyone’s private motives.
examples.zh: 他说话过于自以为是，仿佛知道每个人的私心。

examples.en: It would be overpresumptuously rude to correct the professor without checking the facts first.
examples.zh: 不先核实事实就纠正教授，会显得过分冒失无礼。

examples.en: She overpresumptuously assumed she would be invited to the meeting.
examples.zh: 她过分想当然地以为自己一定会被邀请参加会议。

extraExplanation: 构词：over-（“过度”）+ presumptuous（“冒昧的；自以为是的”）+ -ly（副词后缀）。因此 overpresumptuously 强调“比 presumptuously 更过分”。
语气与使用场景：这是偏正式、带批评意味的词，多用于指出某人“越界、逾分”的自信或擅自行动。在日常口语里更常用 too presumptuously / arrogantly / boldly 等表达。

summary.en: Overpresumptuousness means excessive, boundary-crossing confidence—being too presumptuous.
summary.zh: overpresumptuousness 指“过度的冒昧/自以为是”，即过分自信、越界、太擅自。

definition.en: Excessive presumptuousness: an overly confident, overstepping attitude that goes beyond what is appropriate or respectful.
definition.zh: 过度的冒昧/自以为是：一种过分自信、越界、超出礼貌或分寸的态度。

examples.en: Her overpresumptuousness annoyed the team because she made decisions without asking anyone.
examples.zh: 她的过度冒昧让团队很反感，因为她不征求任何人意见就擅自做决定。

examples.en: The email came across as overpresumptuousness rather than helpful confidence.
examples.zh: 那封邮件给人的感觉更像是过度自以为是，而不是有帮助的自信。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少在日常英语中单独出现，更常见的说法是 presumptuousness（冒昧、自以为是）或直接用形容词 overpresumptuous / presumptuous。
构词：over-（过度）+ presumptuous（冒昧的；自以为是的）+ -ness（名词后缀）。通常用来强调“越界感更强、程度更重”。
语体与语气：带明显的负面评价，常用于批评某人“太敢了/太自作主张”，在正式写作中可以用，但口语里更可能换成 pushy / arrogant / overconfident 等更常用词。

summary.en: Overprice means to set or charge a price that is too high for the real value.
summary.zh: Overprice 指把价格定得过高或要价高于实际价值。

definition.en: to charge more money for something than it is really worth
definition.zh: 把（某物）定价过高；要价高于其实际价值

examples.en: Some online sellers overprice basic items during shortages.
examples.zh: 一些网店在短缺时期把基本用品定价过高。

examples.en: I think they overpriced the used car for its condition.
examples.zh: 我觉得那辆二手车按它的车况来说要价过高。

definition.en: an excessively high price or the act of setting a price too high
definition.zh: 过高的价格；定价过高（的行为）

examples.en: Customers complained about the overprice on bottled water at the stadium.
examples.zh: 顾客抱怨体育场里瓶装水的价格过高。

extraExplanation: “overprice”最常见作动词，表示“把……卖得太贵/定价过高”。名词用法也有，但更常见的是用“overpricing”（定价过高）来表达这种现象。
同义表达：charge too much, price something too high。反义：underprice（定价过低）、discount（打折）。

summary.en: “Overpriced” means something costs more than it’s worth or more than a fair price.
summary.zh: “overpriced”表示某物定价过高，不值那个价。

definition.en: Costing more than it is worth (more expensive than a fair or reasonable price).
definition.zh: 价格高得不合理；价格超过其应有价值。

examples.en: That café is overpriced—the coffee is small but costs $8.
examples.zh: 那家咖啡馆太贵了——咖啡很小却要8美元。

examples.en: The hotel felt overpriced for what it offered.
examples.zh: 就它提供的服务来说，那家酒店感觉不值那个价。

examples.en: I won’t buy it if it’s overpriced.
examples.zh: 如果它卖得太贵，我就不买。

extraExplanation: “overpriced”常用来表达“性价比低/不值这个价”。语气通常偏负面，但比“rip-off（宰人）”更温和、更客观一些。
常见搭配：overpriced meal/clothes/tickets/apartment；be overpriced for what it is（就其本身而言太贵）。
近义词细微差别：expensive（贵但未必不值）；overpriced（贵且不值）；pricey（口语：有点贵）；costly（强调成本高、代价大，不一定指标价）。

summary.en: “Overprices” means charges too much or sets an unreasonably high price.
summary.zh: “overprices”表示“要价过高/定价过高”，即收取不合理的高价。

definition.en: to charge more than is fair or reasonable for something; to overcharge
definition.zh: 对……要价过高；收取不合理的高价（即“宰价/过度收费”）

examples.en: Some hotels overprice their rooms during holidays.
examples.zh: 有些酒店在节假日会把房价定得过高。

examples.en: I think this shop overprices basic items like water and snacks.
examples.zh: 我觉得这家店把水和零食等日用品卖得太贵了。

examples.en: The report says the company overprices its products compared to competitors.
examples.zh: 报告称这家公司相较竞争对手对产品定价偏高。

extraExplanation: “overprices”通常是动词“overprice”的第三人称单数形式（He/She/It overprices...）。更常见的表达还有：overcharge（乱收费/多收钱）、price gouge（趁机哄抬价格，常指灾害或紧缺时期）。

summary.en: Overpricing means setting or charging a price that is too high for what something is worth or what the market expects.
summary.zh: Overpricing 指把价格定得或收得过高，高于物品价值或市场普遍预期。

definition.en: the act of setting a price too high (higher than what customers consider reasonable or what the market supports)
definition.zh: 定价过高；把价格订得高于顾客可接受或市场可承受的水平

examples.en: Overpricing can drive customers to cheaper competitors.
examples.zh: 定价过高会把顾客推向更便宜的竞争对手。

examples.en: The company was accused of overpricing basic necessities during the storm.
examples.zh: 这家公司被指控在暴风雨期间对生活必需品定价过高。

definition.en: charging too much money for something; asking for an unfairly high price
definition.zh: 收价过高；要价不合理地高

examples.en: Some sellers are overpricing used phones online.
examples.zh: 有些卖家在网上把二手手机要价过高。

examples.en: The cafe isn’t bad, but it’s overpricing its coffee.
examples.zh: 这家咖啡馆不差，但咖啡卖得偏贵（要价过高）。

extraExplanation: “Overpricing”通常带有批评意味，暗示价格与价值/成本/市场行情不匹配。商务语境里常与“value for money（性价比）”“pricing strategy（定价策略）”“price-sensitive customers（价格敏感型顾客）”一起出现。
在公共事件中（如灾害、紧急时期），“overpricing”有时会与“price gouging（哄抬物价）”相关，但“price gouging”通常更强烈，强调趁乱牟利、可能违法。

summary.en: “Overprick” is a rare/archaic verb meaning to prick or pierce too much, or (in crafts) to prick through a pattern to transfer a design.
summary.zh: “overprick”是少见/偏古的动词，指“刺扎过度”，或在手工艺中指“沿图样戳孔以转印图案”。

definition.en: (archaic) To prick or pierce something too much or too deeply; to puncture excessively.
definition.zh: （古义）过度地刺、扎或戳某物；扎得太多或太深。

examples.en: Be careful with the needle—you can overprick the fabric and weaken it.
examples.zh: 用针要小心——扎得太多会让布料变薄、变弱。

examples.en: If you overprick the dough with a fork, it may dry out faster in the oven.
examples.zh: 如果你用叉子把面团戳得太密，烤的时候可能更容易变干。

definition.en: (crafts) To prick through a pattern (making small holes) to transfer a design onto another surface; similar to “prick out/prick through.”
definition.zh: （工艺）用针沿图样戳出小孔，把图案转印到另一表面；类似“prick through / prick out”。

examples.en: They overpricked the outline so the design could be traced onto the cloth.
examples.zh: 他们沿着轮廓戳出小孔，好把图案描到布上。

examples.en: In some traditional workshops, patterns were overpricked before painting or embroidery.
examples.zh: 在一些传统作坊里，绘制或刺绣前会先把纸样戳孔转印。

extraExplanation: “overprick”在现代英语中非常少见，多见于较旧的文本或特定手工艺语境；日常表达更常用“prick too much / pierce too deeply”。
注意：单独的“prick”在口语里也可能是粗俗用语或骂人话（指男性生殖器或“讨厌的人”）。在正式或不确定场合，尽量用“poke / pierce / puncture”这类更中性的词，避免误会。

summary.en: Overpride means excessive pride—too much pride that can become arrogance.
summary.zh: overpride 指“过度的骄傲/自尊”，常带贬义，接近“傲慢”。

definition.en: excessive pride; too high an opinion of yourself that can lead to arrogance or poor judgment
definition.zh: 过度的自豪/骄傲；对自己评价过高，可能导致傲慢或判断失误

examples.en: His overpride kept him from admitting he needed help.
examples.zh: 他的过度自尊让他不肯承认自己需要帮助。

examples.en: Overpride can make a small mistake turn into a big problem.
examples.zh: 过度骄傲会让小错误变成大麻烦。

extraExplanation: “overpride”在现代英语中不算常用，更常见的表达是“excessive pride / too much pride / arrogance”。在较正式或带有道德劝诫色彩的语境（如宗教、古典文风）里更可能看到它。
构词上是“over-（过度）+ pride（骄傲/自豪）”。它通常强调“超过适当界限”的骄傲，带有明显的负面评价。

summary.en: Overprint means to print over existing printed material, or the added text/design printed on top of it.
summary.zh: Overprint指在已印内容上再加印；也可指加印上去的文字或图案本身。

definition.en: to print on top of something that has already been printed (often to add new information or cover the old text)
definition.zh: 在已印好的内容上再印一层（常用于添加信息或覆盖原文字）

examples.en: The tickets were overprinted with today’s date.
examples.zh: 票券上又加印了今天的日期。

examples.en: The company overprinted the old labels with the new logo.
examples.zh: 公司在旧标签上加印了新标志。

definition.en: (publishing/printing) additional text or a design printed over an existing page, cover, or image
definition.zh: （出版/印刷）加印在原有版面、封面或图像上的文字或图案

examples.en: The book’s cover has an overprint that says “Revised Edition.”
examples.zh: 这本书封面有加印的“修订版”字样。

examples.en: Look for the overprint to see the updated price.
examples.zh: 查看加印信息以确认更新后的价格。

extraExplanation: “overprint”常见于出版与包装领域：例如在旧包装不重做的情况下，直接在原印刷上加印新价格、新日期或“促销/新版”等信息。
在集邮领域也常见：邮票上的“加盖/加印”（overprint）可能表示改面值、改用途或纪念说明等。

summary.en: Overprinted describes something printed too heavily or printed on top of existing text or images; in philately, it refers to stamps with added printing.
summary.zh: Overprinted 指印刷过重/过多，或在已有文字图像上加印；在集邮中指加印文字或图案的邮票。

definition.en: printed too much, or printed in a way that makes the page look crowded or hard to read (too much ink or too many marks).
definition.zh: （印刷）印得过多、过重，或版面过于拥挤导致难以阅读（墨色过重或信息太密）。

examples.en: The photo looks overprinted, so the dark areas have lost detail.
examples.zh: 这张照片印得过重，所以暗部细节都丢失了。

examples.en: The flyer was overprinted with too many fonts and logos.
examples.zh: 这张传单被印得太满，字体和标志太多。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of overprint) printed words or images on top of existing print.
definition.zh: （overprint 的过去式/过去分词）在已有印刷内容之上再次加印文字或图案。

examples.en: The company overprinted the old packaging with a new price label.
examples.zh: 公司在旧包装上加印了新的价格标签。

examples.en: The book was overprinted with corrections before the second edition.
examples.zh: 这本书在出第二版前加印了更正内容。

definition.en: (stamps) marked with extra letters, numbers, or a new design printed on an existing stamp.
definition.zh: （集邮）在原有邮票上加印额外的字母、数字或新图案（加盖/加印）。

examples.en: The stamp is overprinted with the new country name.
examples.zh: 这枚邮票上加印了新的国名。

examples.en: Collectors look for rare overprinted issues from wartime periods.
examples.zh: 收藏者会寻找战时发行的稀有加印邮票。

extraExplanation: “overprint/overprinted”在出版与包装中常见，表示“在原有印刷上再印一层”（比如改价、贴条码、补充说明）。在集邮领域更常见，指在旧邮票上加印文字/符号，用于改国名、改面值或临时发行。

summary.en: Overprinting means printing over existing ink; in design it’s an overprint setting, and in biology it can mean making new genes from overlapping reading frames.
summary.zh: Overprinting 指在已有印刷内容上叠印；在设计中指“叠印”设置；在生物学中也可指通过重叠阅读框产生新基因。

definition.en: the process of printing on top of existing printed text or images (for example, adding a new layer of ink on a previously printed page)
definition.zh: 在已有印刷文字或图像上再次叠印（例如在已印好的页面上再加印一层油墨）

examples.en: The company used overprinting to add the new price on the old packaging.
examples.zh: 公司用叠印把新价格印在旧包装上。

examples.en: Overprinting can make small text hard to read if the inks are too dark.
examples.zh: 如果油墨太深，叠印会让小字变得难以辨认。

definition.en: in graphic design, a setting where one ink is printed over another instead of “knocking out” the ink underneath
definition.zh: 在平面设计中，一种设置：让一种颜色的油墨直接压在另一种颜色上印刷，而不是把下面的颜色“挖空/镂空”（knockout）

examples.en: Turn off overprinting for the white text, or it may disappear on press.
examples.zh: 白色文字不要用叠印设置，否则上机印刷时可能会“消失”。

examples.en: Designers sometimes use overprinting to create richer, darker colors.
examples.zh: 设计师有时用叠印来做出更浓、更深的颜色效果。

definition.en: in biology, the creation of a new gene by using an alternative reading frame that overlaps an existing gene (gene overprinting)
definition.zh: 在生物学中，通过与已有基因重叠的不同阅读框产生新基因的现象（基因重叠生成/overprinting）

examples.en: Some viruses evolve quickly through overprinting, producing new proteins from overlapping genes.
examples.zh: 一些病毒会通过基因重叠生成快速进化，从重叠基因中产生新蛋白。

extraExplanation: 印刷/出版语境里，overprinting 常和 overprint（叠印）一起出现。与之相对的是 knockout（镂空印刷）：上层颜色会把下层颜色“挖掉”再印，避免颜色混在一起。
在 CMYK 印刷中，若把白色设为 overprint，白墨通常并不会真的印出来（很多情况下相当于“什么都不印”），所以白字可能在成品上看不见。这是排版出错的常见原因之一。

summary.en: “Overprints” means printed additions placed over existing print, or the additions themselves (often seen on packaging, documents, or stamps).
summary.zh: “overprints”指在已有印刷内容上再加印，或指这些加印的文字/图案本身（常见于包装、文件或邮票）。

definition.en: (verb) To print text or a design on top of something that has already been printed (e.g., on paper, packaging, or stamps).
definition.zh: （动词）在已印好的内容上再加印文字或图案（如纸张、包装或邮票上）。

examples.en: The company overprints the expiration date on the label after the main design is printed.
examples.zh: 公司在主要图案印好后，再在标签上加印保质期日期。

examples.en: Some stamps were overprinted with a new value when prices changed.
examples.zh: 有些邮票在价格变化时会加印新的面值。

definition.en: (noun, plural) Printed words or designs added on top of an existing print, often for corrections, updates, or reuse.
definition.zh: （名词，复数）在原有印刷品上加印的文字或图案，常用于更正、更新或再利用。

examples.en: The overprints on the cover indicate the book was sold in a different country.
examples.zh: 封面上的加印字样表明这本书在另一个国家销售。

examples.en: Collectors look for rare overprints on older postage stamps.
examples.zh: 收藏家会寻找老邮票上罕见的加印。

extraExplanation: “overprint”在集邮（philately）里很常见：政府或邮政系统会在旧邮票上加印新面值、纪念字样或新政权名称，以便快速继续使用。
在出版/包装领域，overprint常见于“后加信息”，比如批号、日期、价格等，通常用喷码或热转印等方式加印在已印刷的底稿上。

summary.en: Overprivileged means having more advantages or opportunities than most people, often implying unfairness.
summary.zh: overprivileged 指拥有超出一般人的优势或机会，常暗含不公平的意味。

definition.en: Having more advantages, resources, or opportunities than most people, often in an unfair way (because of family wealth, social class, race, connections, etc.).
definition.zh: （因家庭财富、社会阶层、人脉等）拥有超出一般人的优势、资源或机会，常带有“不公平”的意味。

examples.en: Some students are overprivileged and don’t realize how much help they’ve had.
examples.zh: 有些学生太过优渥，却没有意识到自己得到过多少帮助。

examples.en: He admitted he was overprivileged and tried to listen more before judging others.
examples.zh: 他承认自己享有过多特权，并试着在评判别人前先多倾听。

extraExplanation: “Overprivileged”常用于社会议题讨论，语气可能带批评或反思：不仅指“过得好”，更强调“获得的优势超过应有比例”，让他人更难获得同等机会。
与之相对的常见词是“underprivileged”（弱势的、资源不足的）。在写作中也常与“entitled（自认为理所当然的）”一起出现，但两者不同：overprivileged描述处境与资源，entitled描述态度与行为。

summary.en: Overprize means to value or praise something too highly.
summary.zh: overprize 指“过分看重或过度称赞”。

definition.en: to value or praise something too highly; to think it is more important or better than it really is
definition.zh: 过分看重；过度称赞（把某事物的价值或重要性看得过高）

examples.en: He tends to overprize his own work and ignore useful criticism.
examples.zh: 他往往过分看重自己的作品，而忽视有用的批评。

examples.en: Don’t overprize speed—accuracy matters more in this task.
examples.zh: 别过分追求速度——在这项任务中准确性更重要。

extraExplanation: “overprize”在现代英语中较少见，更常用的是“overvalue”（过高估价）或“overestimate”（高估）。在较早期英语（包括文学作品中），“prize”可作动词，表示“珍视/高度评价”，因此“overprize”就是“过度珍视”。

summary.en: Overprized means too expensive for its real value (often written as “overpriced” in American English).
summary.zh: overprized 指“定价过高、不值这个价”（美式英语更常写作 overpriced）。

definition.en: Too expensive for its real value; priced higher than something is worth.
definition.zh: 定价过高的；价格超过其实际价值的。

examples.en: Many buyers felt the phone was overprized for what it offered.
examples.zh: 许多买家觉得这款手机以它的配置来说定价过高。

examples.en: The apartment looks nice, but it’s overprized compared with similar places nearby.
examples.zh: 这套公寓看起来不错，但和附近类似房源相比价格偏高。

extraExplanation: “overprized”常见于英式拼写；在美式英语里更常见的是 **overpriced**。含义相同，都是“标价过高/不值这个价”。
构词：**over-**（过度、超过）+ **prize/price**（价格）。现代英语中通常用 **price** 来表达“定价”，所以 **overpriced** 更标准、更常用。

summary.en: An overprizer is someone who prizes or values something too highly.
summary.zh: overprizer 指过分看重、过高评价某事物的人。

definition.en: A person who overvalues something; someone who prizes something too highly (often more than it deserves).
definition.zh: 过分看重某物的人；把某事/某物看得过高的人（常指高于其实际价值）。

examples.en: He’s an overprizer of brand names and pays too much for the label.
examples.zh: 他过分看重名牌，为了标签花了太多钱。

examples.en: As an overprizer of praise, she took every compliment as proof she was always right.
examples.zh: 她太看重称赞，把每一句夸奖都当作自己永远正确的证据。

extraExplanation: “overprizer”比较少见，更多时候会用更常见的表达：someone who overvalues…, or a person who overrates…。
它来自动词“overprize”（过分珍视/过分重视），意思接近“overvalue / overrate”。在现代英语里，“overprize”本身也偏文学或较正式。

summary.en: Overprizing means valuing or praising something too highly (often in literary or old-fashioned usage).
summary.zh: Overprizing 指“过度看重、过分赞美、高估”（多见于文学或较旧用法）。

definition.en: (often literary/old-fashioned) valuing someone or something too highly; admiring or praising more than is reasonable.
definition.zh: （常见于文学或较旧用法）过度看重；过分赞美；高估。

examples.en: He was cautious about overprizing fame and tried to focus on his craft.
examples.zh: 他警惕自己过度看重名声，而是努力专注于技艺。

examples.en: Overprizing one small success can make later failures feel unbearable.
examples.zh: 过度看重一次小小的成功，会让之后的失败显得难以承受。

definition.en: the act of valuing or praising too highly (present participle/gerund of overprize).
definition.zh: 过度看重；过分称赞（overprize 的现在分词/动名词）。

examples.en: Overprizing the past kept her from noticing new opportunities.
examples.zh: 过度看重过去，让她忽视了新的机会。

examples.en: They warned that overprizing titles and status can harm a community.
examples.zh: 他们警告说，过度看重头衔与地位会伤害一个群体。

extraExplanation: “overprizing”较少见，常见于较古典或文学语境；现代英语里更常用“overvaluing / overestimating / idolizing”。
注意区分：overprizing（过度看重/高估）≠ overpricing（把价格定得过高）。两者拼写和含义都不同。

summary.en: “Overprocrastination” means procrastinating excessively—delaying tasks far beyond what’s reasonable, often with negative results.
summary.zh: “overprocrastination”指过度拖延——把任务拖到远超合理程度，常带来不良后果。

definition.en: Excessive or extreme procrastination; delaying tasks far more than is reasonable, often causing stress or negative consequences.
definition.zh: 过度拖延；把事情拖到远远超过合理程度，常导致压力或不良后果。

examples.en: My overprocrastination turned a one-hour assignment into an all-night panic.
examples.zh: 我过度拖延把一小时能完成的作业拖成了通宵赶工。

examples.en: Overprocrastination can make small tasks feel emotionally overwhelming.
examples.zh: 过度拖延会让小任务在情绪上变得很难承受。

definition.en: (Informal) A joking or self-critical way to describe one’s habit of procrastinating too much.
definition.zh: （非正式）带点自嘲地形容自己“拖延得太过头”的习惯。

examples.en: Sorry—I’m in my overprocrastination era right now.
examples.zh: 抱歉——我最近就是“拖延过度期”。

extraExplanation: “overprocrastination”不是非常固定、正式的词，更常见于口语、社交媒体或自我吐槽的语境。正式写作中通常用“severe/excessive procrastination（严重/过度拖延）”。
构词上是“over-（过度）+ procrastination（拖延）”。“over-”常用来强调“超过正常或健康的程度”，如“overwork（过度工作）”“overthink（想太多）”。
语用提示：如果你在学术或职场文本中使用，建议换成更常规表达；在轻松聊天、日记或个人表达中用它会更自然。

summary.en: Overproduce means to produce more than is needed or can be sold.
summary.zh: overproduce 指“生产过多/过量生产”，超过需要或市场需求。

definition.en: to produce more of something than is needed, wanted, or can be sold
definition.zh: （某物）生产过多；过量生产（超过需要、需求或销售能力）

examples.en: Some farms overproduce milk in spring when cows produce more naturally.
examples.zh: 一些农场在春季会过量生产牛奶，因为奶牛在这个季节自然产奶更多。

examples.en: The company overproduced smartphones, so it had to discount them heavily.
examples.zh: 这家公司智能手机生产过多，所以不得不大幅打折。

examples.en: If we overproduce, a lot of food may go to waste.
examples.zh: 如果我们过量生产，很多食物可能会被浪费。

definition.en: (in economics/business) to make more goods than the market can absorb, leading to surplus inventory
definition.zh: （经济/商业）产量超过市场消化能力，导致库存过剩

examples.en: When factories overproduce, warehouses fill up with unsold goods.
examples.zh: 当工厂过量生产时，仓库会堆满卖不出去的商品。

examples.en: Overproducing can hurt profits because storage and disposal cost money.
examples.zh: 过量生产会伤害利润，因为仓储和处理都会产生成本。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度/超过正常或需要的程度”，如：overeat（吃太多）、overwork（过度工作）、overreact（反应过度）。
“overproduce”常出现在商业与环境话题中：过量生产会带来库存、降价清仓、资源浪费，以及更多垃圾与碳排放等讨论。

summary.en: Overproduced means made in too large a quantity, or (in music/film) made with too many effects so it feels unnatural.
summary.zh: overproduced 指“生产过量的”，也可指（音乐/影视）“过度制作、修饰太多而显得不自然”的。

definition.en: Made in too large a quantity; produced more than is needed or can be sold.
definition.zh: 生产过量的；产出超过需求或销量的。

examples.en: The factory cut prices because it had overproduced winter coats.
examples.zh: 因为冬季外套生产过量，工厂只好降价。

examples.en: Farmers sometimes overproduce, and the extra food goes to waste.
examples.zh: 农民有时会生产过量，多出来的食物就会被浪费。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “overproduce”: to produce too much of something.
definition.zh: overproduce 的过去式/过去分词：生产过多（某物）。

examples.en: They overproduced the new model, so unsold cars filled the parking lots.
examples.zh: 他们把新款车生产得太多，没卖掉的车把停车场都堆满了。

examples.en: The company realized it had overproduced and slowed down the assembly line.
examples.zh: 公司意识到自己生产过量，于是放慢了生产线。

definition.en: (Film/Music) Edited or arranged with too many effects, layers, or polish, so it feels unnatural or less authentic.
definition.zh: （电影/音乐）过度制作的；加了太多特效、层次或“修饰”，显得不自然或不够真实。

examples.en: The song is catchy, but it sounds overproduced and lacks emotion.
examples.zh: 这首歌很洗脑，但听起来过度制作，少了点情感。

examples.en: Some viewers felt the remake was overproduced compared with the original.
examples.zh: 有些观众觉得翻拍版比原版更“过度制作”。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、超过”。因此 overproduce = produce too much。
在商业语境里，overproduced 常暗示库存积压、价格下跌或浪费；在音乐/影视评论里，则偏向“过度包装、失去质感”的评价。

summary.en: Overproduces means “produces too much,” often more than is needed or can be sold; it can also mean making effects or emotions too strong or excessive.
summary.zh: Overproduces 指“生产过量”，即产出超过需求或可销售的数量；也可指（效果、情绪等）呈现过度、过于夸张。

definition.en: to produce more of something than is needed, wanted, or can be sold
definition.zh: （某物）生产过量；供过于求

examples.en: Farmers sometimes overproduce, and prices fall when there is too much supply.
examples.zh: 农民有时会过量生产，供应过多时价格就会下跌。

examples.en: The factory overproduced winter coats, so many were left unsold.
examples.zh: 工厂过量生产了冬季外套，结果很多卖不出去。

definition.en: to make too much of a result (such as sound, emotion, or effects), often in an unnatural way
definition.zh: （表演/表达/效果等）过度呈现；夸张处理（常带“不自然”的含义）

examples.en: Some movies overproduce the action scenes with too many explosions.
examples.zh: 有些电影把动作场面过度制作，爆炸特效太多。

examples.en: The actor overproduced the emotions, so the scene felt less real.
examples.zh: 这位演员情绪表达得太夸张，所以那场戏显得不够真实。

extraExplanation: “Over-”这个前缀常表示“过度、超过正常程度”（如 overwork 过度工作，overeat 暴饮暴食）。overproduce 的核心感觉是“超过合理/需要的量”，在经济语境里常与“供过于求、库存积压、价格下跌”一起出现。

summary.en: “Overproducing” means producing too much—more than is needed or can be sold.
summary.zh: “overproducing”指生产过多，超过实际需求或可销售的数量。

definition.en: producing more of something than is needed or can be sold (too much output).
definition.zh: 生产（或制造）过多；产量超过需求或销量。

examples.en: The factory is overproducing and now the warehouse is full.
examples.zh: 工厂产能过剩，仓库都堆满了。

examples.en: Overproducing clothing can lead to big discounts and wasted materials.
examples.zh: 服装生产过多会导致大幅打折，并造成材料浪费。

definition.en: the act of producing too much; present participle of “overproduce.”
definition.zh: （overproduce 的现在分词）正在过量生产。

examples.en: They are overproducing to prepare for the holiday season.
examples.zh: 他们正在过量生产，以应对假日季。

examples.en: The company admitted it was overproducing last year.
examples.zh: 公司承认去年生产过量。

extraExplanation: “overproducing/overproduction”常见于商业与经济语境，强调“供给超过需求”，结果可能是库存积压、降价清仓、现金流压力，甚至造成资源浪费。
在环境与可持续发展讨论中，这个词也常用于批评“为了销量而过度生产”，引出“减少浪费、按需生产（make-to-order）”等话题。

summary.en: Overproduction means producing too much—either more goods than the market needs, or (in art/media) so much polish that it feels excessive.
summary.zh: Overproduction 指“过量生产”（超过需求导致积压/浪费），也可指艺术作品“过度制作”（过多修饰导致失真）。

definition.en: The production of more goods than people want to buy, so the extra supply becomes waste, unsold inventory, or causes prices/profits to fall.
definition.zh: 生产过剩；产量超过市场需求，导致积压、浪费或引发降价与利润下滑。

examples.en: The factory faced huge losses because of overproduction.
examples.zh: 由于生产过剩，这家工厂遭受了巨大损失。
